reviewText: This is NOT a free to play game.  This should just be a demo.  I like that they let you rent gear, and try stuff out, but you need every key they give you just to unlock enough gear to play a single game.  If you go in as a free player, you will not have access to the highest tier of upgraded gear.  Which means in end game, on equal skill level, you have no chance.  The time it takes to unlock anything as a free player is ludicrous.\n\nThat being said, I love the theme and style of the game.  I'll leave it installed in hope that there's some balancing to happen.  I would gladly play a little money to play a game where there's no major team disadvantages than to play a free game where I have to hope there are no free players on my team.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good points :
- Excellent and dark athmosphere
- Nice design
- Potentially an excellent good moba gameplay
- seems there will be more than one map

Bad points :
-Still plenty of bugs (crash, or heroes do not always respond very well to your command, like e.g. movement, spell cast)
-Not much heroes

Worst point:
-VERY EXPENSIVE game (or I hope only early access)!! even with the 40 EUR pack, you have nothing (4 heroes/9 and 1 artefact)... You must pay additionnal heroes/weapons/sentinel if you want to have a reasonable content in game...
I started with the 8 euros pack then I went to the 40 EUR pack because the game was too poor with only one hero... Then I added some silver coins 2x 20 EUR. So I spent about 88 EUR for this game and I have the 9-8 available heroes (they removed one in the meanwhile but should come back), 2 skins, 2 sentinels and a bit more than one third of the artefacts.
I could afford that, but
1) many friends don t or just don t want to spend so much for such a game (even if they spend without counting dota2 heores skins)
2) I consider the game still in a very early stage and expect much more content, (aretfact/breed/sentinel/map). But presently it also means much more content to pay... Will I finish to spend more than 500 EUR to get a complete game?
When you are used to other games like dota2 where only skins are not free (and god knows how much i spent in dota2 skins) you can only get disgusted by the deabreed approach of making money.

Ok people could tell that I could get these stuff for free with copper coins...
Indeed you can either pay with real money (silver coins) or by farming copper coins without end... For example the cheapest weapon is a bit more than 1000 copper coins. Without quests achievement, you get about 80 copper coins per game (about 20 min per game) You can get some 100 coins more per quest and you have 3 quest per day.
So if you have plenty of time and you are very patient you can get one or two cheap item per day.

So in conclusion Deadbreed is potentially an excellent game that could even put dota2 in the grave. But it will never happend with such a stinky payment system (kind of pay to play or even pay to win), and I would not recommend this game for this reason.

My recommendation to the guy who make this stinky system:
How are you going to attract sufficient people to handle good equilibrium in matchmaking and without waiting for ages?
Please consider instead a dota2 or even starcraft2 model.

reviewText:
Something that really bothers me with this game is that almost all of the people who gave it a negative review, didn't even take the time to understand how the game works.

First off, there is 2 types of currency, copper coins and silver coins. Copper coins can be earned by completing games, opening chests during matches inside the dungeons and opening chest outside matches as you progress with different breeds. Silver coins can be purchased for real life money and allow you to buy breeds/artifacts/chest without grinding for the copper coins.

Pretty common system, but along with the normal currencies their are keys (bronze, silver gold) you can unlock breeds and artifacts for a certain amount of time depending on the key (bronze=1 game, silver=1 day, gold=1 week) Now here is where people say the game is pay 2 win, they say that the only way to earn artifacts and breeds is with real life money or that you have to grind to get keys to try them out, but most people dont even play the game long enough to realize that while in game and you break a chest/barrel you have a chance to get a bronze key, so as long as you break these things you will always be able to play any breed and any artifact. On top of that you start with 8 of each type of key and gain 2 of each type of key everyweek.

So for the people complaining about the developpers being greedy and that the game is pay 2 win, its not. Just play the game, you will have acess to every artifact just like everyone else who actaully took the time to understand the game. Its worth a try, it has a really unique end fight and each map as its own different play style and strategies.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So this is an early access review as of 4/10/15 of this neat little diamond in the rough, soon before a large patch that might solve a lot of issues that are in game, and my hopes are that the patch will be a reliable gateway to the official release. Anyways, let's begin.

THE GOOD:
● A very unique take on MOBAs, without feeling like a rehash
We all know what it's like when we see another rehash of a popular genre; we look, we scoff, and we turn our heads without looking back. Well in this case, I'm glad I went beyond looking. Deadbreed brings forth a lot of new ideas and unique features such as dungeon crawling, resource management (beyond life+gold+mana), and a variety of interesting objectives along with a wonderful assortment of neat features like character building that I'll discuss in a bit.
● It looks wonderful
Deadbreed has a dark and gritty theme, unlike it's competitors, and it pulls it off very well. It reminds me of Diablo 3 mixed with the darker netural tones of Dark Souls. Whatever you want to call it, it looks and feels genuinely good to play, and the feeling good part will only get better as it develops.
● Great concept for character building
In most MOBAs, you pick your character with a set of moves and you build them in very particular ways. With each character in this game (called Breeds), you have multiple ways to build them. Each breed has four class presets, which change their base-stats to reflect your playstyle. You can unlock artifacts as well to build unique powerful items to compliment your breeds and classes.

THE BAD:
○ Small community/Player-base
This seems to be where half of the complaints are focused. It's hard to get into a game at the moment because the player base is so small and split amongst servers. I think it was a bad decision to create regional servers at this stage, because now there are not enough players to compensate. But that can be fixed just by getting more players to play.
○ Glitches/Bugs are still frequent
This game is early access, and that means you should expect problems. The devs have said many times that they are fixing everything they can, and they are working hard to make this game great. That said, the glitches and bugs can be game-breaking and very annoying, but it's best to log them and report them when you see them. This game isn't done, and you should treat it like you would a beta: report any bugs, contribute to the community, and critique its development. If we can look past the bugs/glitches, and we can see them fixed, the game will reach its full potential much faster. That said, if you don't want to deal with it, wait for the release.
○ Game balance isn't too much of a thing right now
First the glitches have to be fixed, then the game balance can be a primary goal. In its current state, things can be slightly chaotic or snowball-ey or flat out wrong. I don't blame anyone who thinks that is an issue (because it is), but I want to remind you guys yet again that this is in early access. The devs are trying to get this game into a playable state before managing breed balance- which in my honest opinion, isn't too far off as it stands.

Overall, I like this game. A lot. I want to see it become a big name, and I want to see it flourish because it deserves to. The devs have a lot of wonderful ideas, and a lot of the active community so far has been really positive and helpful. If this game's glitches were alleviated, I think it could go far- and I think it will go far, but only if we can start looking past the issues and at the game itself (and if those issues are all we CAN see, then please be helpful and report them. CONTRIBUTE to the game instead of instantly dropping it because you don't like the fact that it's early access).
Thanks guys for looking at my review. I want this game to succeed, and if you give it a chance and help with the development, I really believe we can make Deadbreed a great game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

reviewText: I can't really complain about this game being pay2win since in the couple matches I played I achieved a stellar k/d/a despite running around like a scrub with a starter bow and arrow. This was pretty boring and didn't exactly compel me to play more, get better, earn more gear, etc. There's also something about this game that just feels generic or creatively shallow, like they thought the dark aesthetic would be enough to convince players that the game is cool, or hardcore, or whatever. It was all just instantly forgettable. Then I looked around a bit more and saw how much content actually costs if you want even a minimal amount and I couldn't help but roll my eyes and cynically chuckle. This game isn't horrible by any means but still serves as another example of a type of game development and subsequent marketing that most of us are just hoping will finally die off soon. If you're really inspired by cosmetically dark themes and really into mobas then you might want to putter around with Deadbreed on a rainy day. Otherwise you can safely pass this up and do something cool like your laundry or taxes.  :P

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't get me wrong, this game isn't awful. It's just not in beta condition by a long shot. There are TONS of good ideas in this game, it's not a DotA/LoL clone. However, there's just too much wrong with it to recommend it in its current state even for beta playing. This is not beta state. This is mid/late alpha at best. Minion waves seem to spawn at uneven intervals and tend to wander to the other lane for no descernable reason, the troll you can send after you enemy will often just go forth, do nothing and vanish or attack at the spawn forever because in that spot it keeps coming right back to life and not dying, and objectives (which are a good idea) should have timers but do not. Plus, there is a time limit on matches that makes it hard to actually win the game by anything other than points. I literally did a bot match 1v1 and got troll every time to push the lane as fast as possible and never saw the bot. COMPLETELY UNOPPOSED I still could not beat the timer. Plus, the cost of everything is just too freaking high to warrant playing this. It's too money-grubby.

It looks decent, has great ideas, and when complete it will be amzingly good if they amend the above issues. Right now? The game is in Alpha but thinks it's in beta.

reviewText:
Overall, I'd have to say that spending the $40 on a DLC pack waaay back when it first came out didn't seem like too much of a great idea. It just doesn't seem like I got enough out of it after spending so much. Hell, you could buy $50 or so worth of the in-game currency that you could practically have enough to buy a ton of content.
But enough of all that negative crap.... (Don't worry, I've got more to say)

Positives:
-Good character customization
-Lots of items now
-Artifacts that can change the outcome of a game
-Vote for the boss you want to appear in your team
-Interractive objects in the game
-Lots of item customization (Putting thingamabobbers within Artifact sockets to increase its base stats)
-Good updates that come with plenty of content
-Admins/Creators listen and reply to emails
-Easy to make a PVE match (bots on both teams)
-Dungeons within the matches!
-You can spawn trolls to fight on your side!

Negatives:
-Updates take forever to come out
-Not made for everyone (Especially those who hate grinding)
-Not a guaranteed chance to get in a PVP match (But when an update comes out, this game becomes very popular)
-A somewhat difficult to navigate homepage
-Glitches (but it's excusable because none of them are game breakers)
-New characters/updated characters can be over powered (but updates usually fix this. Most games have things like this though, like League of Legends for example.)
-Items cost a LOT. This is why there is a lot of grinding.
-Artifacts are game changing but are hard to buy because of grinding.
-Characters cost a lot and you are only given one at the beginning (might be different)

I'll keep this up to date as each update comes out.

I know the negatives are massive but this game has the potential to overcome most, or even a good amount, of the issues. I somewhat regret spending money on the DLC because now that I look at what the most expensive DLC gives I see that it would have been better to just get that instead.
Each update that comes out has a large amount of positives to it with so much to offer, but with bugs as well. As stated before, this game isn't for everyone. You don't need to pay to play, invite friends and play PVE or PVP for coins and then use them to buy artifacts or characters.

I'm looking forward to see how this game does out of Beta and I'll stick with it for as long as it continues to give the players what they want.

Update- (To the commentors/anyone else)
I know this game may seem trashy now, especially with how it's somewhat Pay-2-Win when you just start playing. Just give it a chance and if you don't like it then that's fine. Everyone's opinions are accepted here :3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

thought i would write an honest review as someone who has over 70 hours ingame rather than people with less than 2.

first thing you need to know is this game is in early access thus has all the relivent problems you find in any early acces the game is not a fully polished model. currently there are only 2 server 1 is eu other is an na/sa server you will automaticly be placed into your relivant server other regions are currently blocked ( this should change in the future but i have no date on this )

the best time to currently play is in the evenings when most people are on. The comunity atm is quite small so dont expect game after game at the moment im sure this will improve as with every update the game becomes more polished.

you will need to play atleast 5 bot games before you look for a normal match just to get yourself used to the way you buy items test skills and get the general flow of the game this is quite easy to pick up you may not even need 5.

All artifacts and breeds ( heroes whatever you want to call them ) in game can be purchased  with silver ( premium paid for ) coins or copper coins that you can earn from daily quests and playing in matches though not required to win a game will help. you can unlock these for a set amount of time with keys copper for 1 game silver for 1 day and gold for 1 week you get a set amount of these keys per week and they are replenished every week. i would suggest while in bot games you use the copper keys to unlock artifacts/breeds to try so you can find which ones fit your play style and so you know what to buy 1st, you can get copper keys as a random drop from chests in dungeons inside the game weather your in a bot or normal game.

if you get a beta key you will start with 1 breed there are currently 9 to choose from.

when you buy a piece of armour or a weapon ingame you can see it on you breed skins and other bits of customasation will become available at a later date.

this game has alot of potential and i would highly recommend it if you will take the game as it is currently ( early access ) if you want a 100% polished game then i would suggest you wait till later in its development when more of the kinks are polished.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I APOLOGIZE IF MY ENGLISH IS NOT GOOD, I HAVE PLAYED LEAGUE OF LEGENDS AND DOTA 2 FOR A SOLID 300-400 HOURS EACH. I AM JUDGING THE GAME FOR IT'S CURRENT STATE AND AM AWARE IT IS EARLY ACCESS. I AM NOT A PROFESSIONAL REVIEWER (JUST A GAMER WITH AN OPINION)



I am very sorry, this game has A TON of potential. But in it's current state I do not recommend this, at all. There are a TON of bugs, a very user-unfriendly interface (Both in-game and in the lobby)  and no tutorial (Atleast have a tutorial when you're selling a MOBA)

Another reason being is the lack of players. The average amount of players is around 5. No I did not miss a 0 behind the 5. Literally 5 people. On a side note, I have bought the Beta Deluxe pack which is far from the value you would consider getting for 35 Euro's.

At the moment the choices in Breeds (Champions, Heroes, however you would like to call them) is very minimal. The ideas behind the Breeds is very good and innovative, having Daybreeds and Nightbreeds, depending on your Breed of choice this might, or might not, impact your abilities and/or game.

The thing I liked the most about the game is the ability to see what you have bought. By that, I mean that if you buy an axe for example, you are wearing that exact same axe in your hand, or both of your hands if you like to dual wield.

Despite of this game having alot of potential, having to pay atleast around 20 Euro's to get into the closed Beta is ridiculous, I understand it is Early Access but this has gone a bit too far.

You can also level up and gain Rank Points which you can spend to Upgrade your artifact, an in-game item which you have to buy with Silver Coins (Premium Currency) or the currency you gain by playing games, which is hard to do with a lack of players. You can also spend them on your breeds to increasy their stats such as Vitality, Strength etc.

People might say that the lack of players doesn't really matter this much because you can play against bots. There are 2 main problems with this. #1: Eventually you would like to play this game against people, if people have to play bot matches to give feedback, they might take the bots into consideration without noticing because a game with bots is far from the same as a game with actual players. #2: The bots are so damn easy, I have literally seen this a dozen times, an ally/enemy Breed attacks an enemy/ally breed while they are at 50 HP and the opposing breed is at Full-HP, this should be basic programming and should already be fixed.They also appear to not care about any Creep aggro what so ever since they will most likely die to Creeps more than to enemy Breeds. Instead of trying to kill you, they will ignore you when you are on low HP rather than chasing you a bit and trying to actually kill you.

Below I will list the pros and cons (My personal opinion) of this Early Access game (I am not a professional reviewer, I just like to write these. I am just a gamer with an opinion):

Pros

- Appearance changing depending on the items you buy.
- Interesting Breed System".
- Cool theme

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well... Let me set this straight.
It is a brilliant unfinished game with all the downsides of, well, unfinished game. But it is still brilliant.

What's so good in it?
1. Artwork.
The game has its own style, that resembles a little the Bloodborn and the Dark Souls universe. It's dark, it's grim, it's a no-hope-ever kind of a world with undead fighting undead.

2. Character gear system.
Amazing quality character models with the gear that customizes the looks, the stats and the gameplay at the same time. Remember getting all sorts of weird things to boost stats in other MOBAs? Forget it. No more buying two-handed axes for an archer.
Aaand btw, it's a game where you can be literally anything. Did you ever want to build a heavily armoured archer? It's your pick.

3. Unlocking system and ranks.
When you first time peek inside it may look a little too much of everything to get/unlock, but it's fairly easy to get everything to play. Key drop is more that enough on its own, and you can get extra keys (!) in actual game, raiding lootboxes in the dungeons.

4. Easy to start.
I've got the basics in the first five training games (against AI), and totally loved one of the breeds. In fact, I've found a class I really like in less than an hour, and that is amazing (didn't get a hero I like in Dota after 1000 hrs).

5. Character and class balance is unusual and challenging - some characters excel at AOE DPS (while being tasty targets), some are good at disabling enemies and duelling them (heavy-armoured champions with Stun abilities) and some are fine as supports. Counter-pick here is way, WAY more important than in other MOBA-style games.

6. Time limit.
24 minutes is more than enough to have fun and a perfect point before I get bored. Those hour and a half Dota runs I hated are gone. Well, you'll feel how good the time limit is it when you hit the score victory.

What's bad?

1. Low player base.
Since the game has little to no marketing there's not much people to play it. This leads to facing very experienced opponents from your very first PvP matches, so better bring your friends... Or risk getting ♥♥♥♥♥ in the worst possible way.

2. As I've mentioned already the balance is unusual. It exists, but, well, it may feel unfair a lot when you farmed all slots to the top and still being ♥♥♥♥♥ by asassins.
Let's say the balance in this game does not forgive you for the mistakes you make on the battlefield.

3. Confusing controls are very confusing. It was an hour to get the thing: you have to manage the range between your character and the target manually, since the character just won't attack if the target is out of range. Silly standing in the middle of the fight because you misclicked? It's here, wrap some.

Conclusion: while the game feels nice, there's a lot to go for. Hopefully devs can make something to inscrease the playerbase (most pressing issue, as I am not a fan of being professionally ♥♥♥♥♥) and remake controls. Some polishing here and there won't hurt aswell.

Still, a nice game to play with firends.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Thanks Deadbreed developers for giving me a chance to test their game, here is my early access review.

I just don't like this game. The graphics and atmosphere is really good and different. But the gameplay is just broken.

Firstly lets talk about what is good about this game. The gothic atmospehere, character models look great up-close. I like the idea that that when you buy an item in-game, unlike Dota 2, it actually appears on your character. Heroes are very flexable, meaning they can fill any role with the right build. Pacing of the game feels good. The game is slow paced but it is actually a good thing if you are tired of right clicking like crazy in dota 2 or lol.

Abilities are just broken, animations and effects of the abilities are just bad. You can't even understand what is going on when you are playing it. And abilities themselves are just designed bad. They are mostly useless and you can't make good combos with them. Obviously the game has a lot of bugs but i don't mind it, it's beta after all. Controls are just again, bad. Sometimes you won't even know why an ability isn't working even though you have full mana. Right click does not cancel the ability. There is no auto-attack, or maybe there is, sometimes your hero will start to runing backwards or just stop fighting in the middle of a teamfight or when you are farming. Even though the character models are crafted beautifuly, the animations are bad.

Matchmaking can take a lot of time. Sometimes same person appears again and again, declining the match, stoping you from playing the game and this happend after you wait for like 5 minutes for game to find 6 people to play with.

There are a lot of impovements needed if this game wants to have even 10% of the success dota 2 or even Smite has.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Decided to do a complete review overhaul after getting to play the game more. I'll keep a pros and cons list, and try to update at times if things change. I for one love the game despite it's issues and am holding out hope that the community grows to make it more fun, as matchmaking is one of the major flaws due to low player activity.

Pros
- Very customizable heroes (Including class/playstyle/equipment).
- Great atmosphere.
- Practice Mode (learn the game against bots, while gaining money).
- Everything except cosmetic player skins is obtainable for f2p players.
- Good mix of heroes, providing unique playstyle options.
- Every Hero can use any item.
- Can add sockets in artifacts for additional bonuses.
- Artifacts provide additional skills.
- Free hero for new players is quite good.
- Can improve hero stats through account leveling.

Cons
-Occasional lag spikes.
-Occasional ctd's.
-Only 1 map right now.
-Not many heroes and items yet.
-Low player base, hard to find matches without friends.

reviewText:
Review made on 29.05.2016.
---Short review---
Pros :
1.Items affect champion looks and attacks
2.Interesting map creeps and additional events in maps
3.Well made champions
4.Game is not as much as destruction as tactical play, objective - based maches
Cons :
1. It can be some while, before you get your second champ permamently
2.Low population
3.Some mechanics aren't intuitve and player needs to get used to.
---Long review---
This game is mix of traditional MOBA like Dota 2 or League of Legends and roguelike dungeon crawlers like Path of Exile. Maps are only for 3v3 or 2 v 2. Interesting part of this game, is that items that you buy for your champion actually affect their looks and abilities, like auto attacking. UI isn't really intuitive, but if you can read, you will manage. Champion rooster isn't really big, but each one of them is really made. Maps have interesting affects and objectives, like in Zodiac map you can spawn additional hordes of undead skeletons and such.Also, if you really like a champion, you can add stars to upgrade their stats. It works like runes in League of Legends.
The game has really interesting and different pay model, for theese kind of games. Firstly, every champion can be bought by ingame currency or real life money. The campions are pretty expensive around 8k ingame money. At start you get one free, which isn't as bad. But to ceck out others, you can use keys - bronze, silver and gold keys. They unlock champions for a limitted time - 1game, 1day or 1week.
The game has progression, but it actually makes new players lose more. Many objectives or artifacts (unique epic items, that reallly change the flow of the game) can only be bought on high profile levels. This really puts new players in disadvantage.
The population isn't really big, but if you got free time on your hands, usually you can get match in 2-7 minutes. The match length is 25 minutes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Check the bottom for my updates! (Newest update, 12/16/14)


As this game is still in early access, my review will be in my early stages of the early access.

This MOBA has a lot of excellent, innovative ideas. Some ideas are implemented to perfection, while others are extremely lackluster. I'll shine some light on a handful of ideas that I love, while I go into detail about some of the things that could use some work.

Pros:

- Ridiculous number of in-game items: Not only do have a choice of a number of different items, but the items are placed on your character straight away. You can dual wield two different weapons and look like a bad ♥♥♥! Your helms, shoulder armor and body armor will all appear on your character, which could make you look like an intimidating specimen. Some armor and weapons are so cool that you need to unlock them before you can use them, which brings me to my next point.

- Keys and currencies: Keys (which are separated by copper, silver and gold) are for a number of different purposes. You can use keys to unlock playable characters (for one match, one day or even one week), unlock items/insignia, or even enter a dungeon in-game for a chance at obtaining even more keys and loot! The currency is very similar to other MOBAs, as you have silver coins, which is purchased with real money, and you have copper coins, which you gather from playing in-game. Of course, you can use either currency for character, weapon/item or insignia purchases.

- General characters: Although I have only played with a few characters, I can tell you that I really enjoy each particular creature's unique talents. The detail on each Breed or Sentinel is fantastic and the dark, horrific scheme that is given to each character is different from your everyday MOBA. Although the character details and skills are different from one another, you can customize your character in-game to play any way that you wish, as your items will generally determine what type of class you are (this doesn't change your skills, only the power of your basic attacks)

- Boss fights: This is an interesting twist on the MOBA genre. In general, the end of a 3v3 or 5v5 game in a MOBA ends with one team destroying a large tower or power source. In Deadbreed, the object is to defeat a gigantic boss, which is voted upon before entering the game. Theses bosses can have multiple health bars and could take time defeating, depending on how early your team makes it through the Crux (the door leading to the boss room). These bosses add an extra challenge and spin to the genre, and I prefer that to simply beating on a dead, worthless pillar for 30 seconds.

These are the more positive things that I have gathered from my short playing time thus far. I am sure I will continue to update my post as I play more often and add to my (short) hour count.

Here are the ideas and implementations that I am hoping the developers could take a look at, and possibly change.

Cons:

- In-game shop and filtering: Although I am extremely pleased with the amount of items, weapons and armor that is available via the in-game shop, I grew increasingly frustrated with how much time it was taking to find particular items that I was searching for. You can filter by the item type or by the effect of the item, but it does not seem that you can filter by the cost of the item. I like to spend pretty much all my gold at the shop, and would love to use it all on one item, but I have to sift through a number of randomly priced items in order to find the one I'm looking for.

- Shop location and purchasing: Probably my biggest issue with this game thus far, is the fact that you cannot purchase items while you are in the process of respawning. As a matter of fact, you cannot purchase items unless you are in an extremely precise location in your home base. At one point, I had to basecamp while standing in my home base, because I was not in the correct spot to purchase items. We should be able to purchase items while respawning, as it will keep the game moving quickly. We should also increase the size of the area in which purchases are allowed (maybe at the top of the steps on each side of the base?).

- Creepers: I thoroughly enjoy the creepers in this game. They can be troublesome early on, but I have found them to be more annoying then anything. In most MOBAs, you can stand behind your creepers and let them take the punishment. In general, the enemy creepers won't attack you unless you're the first person they see or all the friendly creepers have died. In Deadbreed, you can be attacked by creepers at any moment, regardless of how many friendly creepers are attacking them. I don't like this idea. I feel like creepers should be used as decoys so champions can go toe-to-toe without having to worry about getting their butts smoked by little creeps.

- Community/Player base: I haven't had any issues with the community in general, but I will say that it does take quite a bit of time to get a PvP game going. Perhaps, it's because there isn't a large community of players? Either way, it's frustrating when you pay $9.99 for a game (I got the Undertaker version) and you have to wait long periods of time to get into a game. I am hoping this game either goes free-to-play, or makes the appropriate changes to increase it's player base.

Again, I will continue to update this as I go along. I have really enjoyed this game and will continue to play. I am hoping the developers will take a look at these suggestions and at least acknowledge what could be used to help make this game even better! Until then, I will add to my current record total (in terms of hours played) and see what else I can find during my gameplay. Thanks for reading!


UPDATE (12/16/2014): The developers implemented a new patch on December 12th and a number of the concerns/issues I had with the game have been addressed!

Positives:

- You can now open up the shop while you are in the process of respawning.
- You no longer have to stand in that one specific spot in your home base in order to purchase items. As long as you're in the general vicinity of your home base, you are good!
- You can now practice with one or two friends, instead of just yourself.
- There is an auto purchase feature that allows you to purchase items much faster.
- There are now breakable barrels scattered throughout the map with gold inside to use for in-game purchases.
- The banners (used to obtain team points by capturing and burning the other team's banner) have been moved to opposite sides of the map, which proves a bit more challenging than before.

Negatives:

- AI is more intelligent than before, but can still be pretty stupid. They generally don't try to avoid getting killed from turrets and they only start running from human players when they are extremely close to dying.
- I find it difficult to hide in the grass. You kind of have to stand there for a few seconds before going invisible and when you try to base camp, you are no longer invisible. You should be invisible in the grass even when you are trying to base camp.
- Would like if you could open up the shop at any point in time. Would make it easier to purchase items if I could open up the shop in the process of base camping.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, I only played one match, and it was just a practice match with AIs since it's my first time playing this game.

I have played DOTA2 alot, and I am aware of what MOBAs are. reviewText:
OK first of all, and I hope at least some people reading reviews see this:

This game is not pay to win. Not. At. All.

Ok sure, you want everything available, all breeds and artifacts? well that's not possible for a beginner. But there is something called the key system, which means you can use keys to unlocks breeds and artifacts, for varying amounts of time depending on key.

And keys can be found in every PVP game, just smash barrels like you are playing diablo...

So this means? well it means you can get keys by playing, in turn play with the breeds and artifacts you so wish. That's what I do, and it's no problem whatsoever..

Also free keys per week are put in your account in case you are too lazy to right click a barrel in game.


Honestly enough with these reviews from people who straight up haven't played the game enough to understand the basic system in place.


ASIDE from that, it's a fun moba with some interesting mechanics. Wearable items, alternate routes to victory, some new types of strategy..

If you want to try something different and you are patient, you will be rewarded with a fun game that costs you nothing.. unless you want to support the dev.

So yeah, enough with the hate. Steam reviews people act like sheep I swear.

PS. You can get premium stuff from a random chest drop after each game, win or lose. I've gotten great stuff.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I do like this new moba, it looks great, it's not hard and it's something different.
But there are a few things that i find really necessary to change if you want it to become big.
First of all, Remove this whole 'use keys to unlock' thing, seriously, it's already clear that if you want to be a high ranked player you need to or grind, or pay, don't overdo it.
second of all: make the target boxes bigger, when someone is running away or coming at you, it's really difficult to select that person, especially with the optimalization now.
3th: give a better tutorial

These are all the things IMO that needed to be changed to make the game go big, it's a fun game and a very decent moba, with a unique look at great graphics.
Say no to pay to win, say yes to pay to customise. We all know that people will do that eventually.
Either way for the openbeta version i give it a 7/10, because it's fun to play, looks great and has interesting mechanics, BUT the optimalisation is ♥♥♥♥, hitboxes and some bugs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played quite a few multiplayer battle arenas (MOBA's), and some were considerably better than others.

For an early access, this game is surprisingly good and has a lot of potential. I played a bit of Dead Island: Epidemic, and I think I like this one more just because of the depth in gameplay mechanics (DI: Epidemic is definitely a lot easier to jump into right away).

If you like MOBA's, challenging gameplay, and demonic/dark themes, then you will definitely enjoy Deadbreed.

The aesthetics are very, very good. I was so surprised when I realized every piece of equipment you buy in-game is actually visible on your character. League of Legends and Smite were my two main MOBA's of choice, and neither had that kind of aesthetic mechanic. The music and sounds are pretty good too, and they work well with creating a grim, dark atmosphere for the player.

The controls are not too difficult if you are familiar with MOBA's, however, there are times when it may feel unresponsive and messy (keep in mind this game is still a long work in-progress). The learning curve may be somewhere between moderate to fairly difficult if you are not used to this style of gaming - there are a few new mechanics that allow for deeper gameplay than MOBA's like League of Legends.

Grinding is reasonable, nowhere as slow/long as Dead Island: Epidemic's (sorry to compare, but that game is still pretty fresh in my mind and they are both currently in early access). In order to fully experience the game - in particular, the highest-tier equipment - you will need to farm a large number of resources by playing many games. There are artifact equipment (weapons and armor), and each item is a considerably stronger upgrade from its previous tier.

During gameplay, you will be doing either 1vs1, 2vs2, or 3vs3, spread over 2 lanes (top and bottom, going left-to-right). I strongly recommend you try out practice mode with bots just to get a feel for the gameplay. There are 3 different types of drops you can pickup - yellow nectar, blue, and red (forgot the names). The red drop will always be in the middle of the map, while the yellow nectars will be in fixed points in a circle around the middle of the map. For the blue drops, enemies will periodically drop them as they die. The primary function of these 3 drops is to beef up your artifact items (which grant them bonuses AND carry over through subsequent games), however, you will be using these for more basic things in the beginning - at least until you play enough to unlock your first artifact.

The red drops can be used to summon a troll (the summoning stone is located in the center of the map, on the top lane). After placing the red orb, the troll will appear in a cutscene after 30 seconds. The troll is primarily neutral, however, you can issue commands like follow and guard to it (thus far it seems a bit unreliable). Be warned, you should make sure you have at least 1 nectar in your possession so the troll does not decide to attack you on sight - in fact, having more than 1 nectar may be advised.

The yellow nectars will initially be used as a repel for the troll. The blue orbs are extremely useful because you can spend them to decrease your respawn time (which is already very reasonable).

The item selection is fantastic, however, it certainly needs A LOT of work. The menu and screen for the store is small and very, very annoying to navigate through (especially if you are used to playing other MOBA's). The tabs for the inventory are very small, and it is hard to scroll through to find the item you want. A nice feature during the preloadout is the 10 seconds you are given to select your equipment before the match starts (if you want that head start). While in the store, you can see your character standing and how each equipment piece will look. Numbers on your avatar represent which equipment slot will be used (ex: 5" for shoulder armor). Currently
date: the information given for each equipment piece is short and simple - no lore if you were looking for that. The overall feedback for the game (ex: character info bars) needs lots of work
recommended: but can only get better from here.\n\nJungling (deviating from the "lane" to fight neutral monsters so your partners get more experience since you won't have to share) is very
hoursPlayed: very refreshing in this game. To jungle

Highly recommend!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

READ THIS FIRST!: In the update that rolled out on 15.11.2014 the game was made a billion times better than it was before. The update fixed most crucial bugs and so on and updated the interface, graphics and gameplay to pure awesomeness in my opinion.

This review is coming from a person who has played MOBAs for about 4 years.
First, I'd like to address the good and bad sides of this game, then tell about the gameplay.
Pros:
Epic music
Nice graphics
Innovative and good design ideas
Unique features
Great illustrations

Cons (Remember that this game is Early access):
Glitchy at times (but only sometimes)
Small playerbase
Buggy sometimes (only sometimes)
Needs a slight bit of work (Inconsistent hitboxes etc.)
Kinda stupid AI (bots just go forward and hit whatever they encounter and don't stop until it's dead pretty much, although it has been improved.)
The game may crash sometimes but it's rather rare

And now, the gameplay: Deadbreed is pretty much like your normal MOBA, if you have played League of Legends' Twisted Treeline-map, this game's map is very similar to that one: two lanes and a jungle" area in between of them. (a new map came out in the update I previously mentioned
date: it is similar in core gameplay as the 'normal' map but there's a quest to it: there's a sword in the middle of the map that you can obtain to gain special powers
recommended: otherwise the goals are the same)(EDIT TO PREVIOUS STATEMENT: that new gamemode is in the works but it hasn't come out yet.)  There are no neutral monsters like in LoL or Dota 2
hoursPlayed: instead there are dungeons in which there are neutral monsters that attack you automatically. There are also a few minibosses in the dungeons. The core gameplay is the same as in LoL and Dota though. You have to destroy the enemy's towers and then their Crux (a door). Behind that door is the boss that you have to defeat in order to win the game. This boss is much like LoL's Baron or Dota's Roshan. If neither team has defeated the enemy-sides boss when 25 minutes have passed
voteText: the team with most points will win. The bossfights were made very very intense and fun in the update that came 15.11.2014. You get points from kills

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Deadbreed is a moba that has dungeons and really cool breeds (champions) as well as really cool base bosses. Now in a usual moba you're destroying their base's power source but in this game you kill a huge demon monster (at the moment there is only one). Breeds are also pretty unique in this game as in their abilities grow stonger with one of or more of these pick ups, these picks up are Spirits which you get from killing minions, breeds, or dungeon creeps, Blood which spawns in the middle of a map next to a tree, or Nectar which spawns in three places, next to your base, at the vary bottom of the map, and next to the enemy's base. About the enemy's base, where they (the enemy) spawn they don't have an in base turret so you can just walts right in and take their flag, I'll get to that in a moment. There may not be a tutorial but you can also go into practice mode to look at the shop and experiment with w/e you want.

The dungeons in this game are what you'd see in a flash game on newgrounds which isn't a bad thing. There are three dungeons in the Graveyard map (the only one at the moment) Your base's dungeon, the middle dungeon which alternates between a crypt of skeletons or a lair of spiders, and the enemy's base's dungeon. Each dungeon has a boss, your dungeon and the enemy's dungeon both have goblins in them while the middle one has either skeletons or spiders. Also each dungeon has chests in them, yours and theirs (the enemy's) dungeon both have three chests in them while the middle one for both kinds of monsters have five chests. Depending on which kind of chest it is results in the amount of loot you get. Small chests drop 50-60 gold pieces and have a chance to drop keys and copper coins. The medium chest has a chance to drop 80-150 (I think) gold pieces and keys and copper coins, some times you can get two keys and two drops of copper coins.

Now there are three types of keys, bronze, silver, and gold. They can unlock artifacts or breeds depending on which key you use. Bronze keys unlocks an item one match, silver keys unlocks an item for one day, and the gold key unlocks an item for one week. Its a good way not to get burned on a purchase. For the coins you earn the copper coins you get are from completing matchs and daily quests and silver coins are acquirable by spending real money.

There are also two ways to win in this game, either winning by points when the time runs out or killing their Sentinel (The big bad demon monster). You can earn points by killing enemy players, collecting nectar and blood, and by grabbing the enemy's flag and burning it at your base's forge.

Ohhhh goodie my favoirte part about this game. In the in game store (not inside a match) there are these powerful armor pieces and weapons you can buy with either real money(Silver coins), copper coins or unlocking with keys. Each artifact can hold one spirit, blood, or nectar. Spirit adds health, Blood adds attack damage, and Nectar adds power damage. These gems" lets call it
date: will level up with each win. Artifacts can also be leveled up while in a match to add more w/e it has/does.\n\nComing to my conclusion Deadbreed is a worth while buy
recommended: sure it has its bugs but what online game doesn't? If you don't like it that's fine but you should leave a comment on the forums of why you didn't like it and maybe they'll improve on that."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Are you a person who likes games like DOTA or League of Legends but always wished there was more character customization? Then this is the game for you.

Wish your ancient or nexus fought back in an epic battle to finish the match? Then this is the game for you.

Ever wanted to dungeon crawl with your hero or have something else to do besides just run down a lane and fight endless creep (although it could be called jungling)? Then this is the game for you.

Ever wanted to summon a troll and watch it rampage into other player? Well guess what you can do that too.

Although it is still in development this game is already very well done. As for now I will give it a 9.5/10 with a more prominent review after full release.
voteText: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCurrently, in the state the game is in, is a fun MOBA to play when you're too frustrated with the communities of games such as LoL and DOTA, and you're wanting to just play an up and coming MOBA that has extreme potential.  This MOBA has the capabilities of being something far greater than any MOBA anybody has played, and I am extremely excited to see where it goes.  With Unique Mechanics such as the Banners, Nectar/Spirit/Blood, Dungeons, and Boss Fights, it gives players a unique feel to what once was just a tower rush.  Yes, you can play just like your Standard MOBAs, shoving the lane to the home base, destroying it, and gaining victory, but that would just scratch the surface of this MOBA.  I could write all the great things about the game in this review, but it's easier if you either find someone on Youtube who has made videos on this game, or someone who is streaming it on Twitch (which there are a few people who are doing so.)  That, or just play the game yourself.  Only warning though, it's still an Early Access game, which means that sometimes, abilities don't work right just yet, or sometimes, your characters won't be animated when they move.  However, I still recommend this game to any MOBA lover out there.

The battle part is really interresting, you would really enjoy donjons, being able to summon the troll, capture the flag. This innovative way to play a MOBA will be appreciate by the large majority of gamers.

I expect for the futur :I'm still wondering for more maps. Only a graveyard with two paths, three nectars and a blood generate only one kind of way to play...
> Why not create map with more paths, more blood, maybe less nectar, and then create a new way to fight and playing with other strategy!
a 3vs3vs3 battle.

Characters are really nice, expected more coming soon (currently only one real tanker ... a second would be great) Battle really enjoying, with some strategy, ...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Game is Awesome, the customuzation is great, the verity of combonations is immense, and very enjoyable, kinda tricky to understand, but eventually you get it, you can devide it into cons and pros.

PROS
-The veriations are great, you can be a bowman in one game, and a swordman in the other.
-The Whole Idea of the game is fantastic, and you can feel like you are doing an impact.
-The visuals are great and beautiful, you can get that feel of the creepy map while playing.
-The Audio is great aswell and you can feel the creep.(DE CREEP IS REEL).
-In game dungeon is fun and great.

CONS (I understand the game is still in beta, therfore ill list some cons for now)
-The shop interface is a bit wierdish , and not specific enough(defansive means all the different armors wich consumes alot of time to find the apropriate slots)
-There are some bugs with abillities, not casting in time, visuals not matching, and range doesnt match.
-The damage indicator sometime accurs before the strike was even delivered.
-missing a tutorial of all the functions.

Overall for the beta i would rate 8/10, and im 100% sure it will get to be 10/10, just for now need to tend to thouse tricky bugs and problems, once smooth that out, the game would be just PERFECT, I recommend this game very much, its a whole lot of fun, even playing by yourself in practice is fun, and you customize your champion in cool ways, its realy intresting to play, and the dungeon function is just brilliant, its like a game inside a game. and I realy hope that they will continue to improve it !

Hope to see you guys succeed ! :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

OVERVIEW

Deadbreed is your everyday generic MOBA games that introduce nothing and it just an attempt cash off due to MOBA genre being popular ( all thanks to Dota 2 & League Of Legends ). Don't get me wrong but it seems this game is souless and doesn't provide long-lasting enjoyment. I was curious about this game cause it had some interesting character design but when the game released it nothing what i had expected.

GAMEPLAY : 4/10

Unlike some MOBA games that have 5 vs 5,this game only provides 3 vs 3 which baffles me why did they go with this design choices. In my opinion,the less player they are,the less fun and chaotic it gets.

To those who is a hardcore of MOBA fan,this game is an easy,pick & go. However to those who are new to MOBA games may struggle because this game doesn't provide any tutorial on how to play the game. You will be wondering what the hell am i doing and what item i going to purchase.

Once you picked your guardian and your breed,you are given an amount of time to buy your equipment before the game start. Why not just let you buy your equipment after the game start ??? Such a incompetent and horrid design choices.

I suggest you play with online player and not with AI. Why ? Because the AI is braindead !!!! Each AI don't have their own pathfinding and they just charge straight to a tower like a raging idiot even though there is no minion to help the Breed ( known as Hero or Champion ). The tower is design to shoot all the minion first then the breed last which is a bad design choice when the breed have a powerful items which can utterly destroy the tower in a second.

You basically have two towers,one crux which guards the behemot. If they manage to destroy your crux and killed your behemot then it game over for you.

Each breed have their own skills & spells but it no fun to use and just rather spam the right-click button instead.

Oh did i not mentioned that the higher levels you are,the stronger your breed get ? Yup,as each level up you gained,you receive an rank points which able to let you upgrade your breed and artifacts. Why do they think it a good idea it just make me shake my head even more. Basically low level players will struggle against high level players.

And also you are force to choose only one breed and the rest you need to unlock. If i am not mistaken there isn't even have breed rotation so you are stuck to that one breed until you have enough gold to purchase another one. Take note that each match gained you 100 gold point and you need 4k+ gold points to unlock a breed. Really grindfest.

GRAPHICS : 3.5/10

The graphics in this game is bad. You can't configure your graphics settings because their isn't any options apart from vertical sync and resolution. Environment is extremely bland as well as the character when it is zoom out. The particles is just bad looking too.

Don't get me started on the animations. Each breed doesn't have their own unique death animations and they all share the same death animations. The walking animations is ok but the attacking animations is just laughable especially the behemot.

They also rip-off the day & night transitions from Dota but it extremely poorly done.

Only one things i like is that whatever equipment you buy it will actually show on your characters but that about it.

AUDIO : 4/10

The soundtrack in this game is just meh. Each of the breed voice felt like they wanted to sleep and don't felt like a bad-@ss. It applies to the same as the announcer voice. The sounds of the spells & skills is average at best.

LONG-LASTING APPEAL : 3/10

Long-lasting appeal for this game ?? Hah,there isn't any at all. Not at least for this early access version. You will be playing the same things with the same breed over & over again. I already get bored playing 2 match and don't want to touch this game anymore.

FINAL VERDICT : 3.6/10

Stay far away from this game. If you don't believe me what i have type in my review then go try it yourself. The game is an extreme borefest and just a lame attempt cash-off from a MOBA genre. I know from this start this game is going to be a generic MOBA games despite it interesting character design. Even though i don't speak for all,there is some MOBA fan that understand this games is just another lame MOBA games.

GRADE : U ( Catastrophe )

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I think this game has great potential, but for now still needs work (of course it's still an early access beta).  Despite being a MOBA, it plays differently than League of Legends or Dota 2, which is refreshing considering there are games out there that copy that format.  However, it could use a tutorial and a more user-friendly interface, as trying to figure out everything by yourself is a little exhausting.  A description for each character in the lobby area would be helpful, as sometimes I don't know what kind of character each is until I start playing.
The items in the shop are all in a long list so it's hard to look at them all and compare to see which you should get.  Also it's difficult at first figuring out how to buy and sell items (e.g. you can't buy a two slot item if you already have one of those slots full).  The slot system is neat, however, as well as all the equipped items showing on your character.  It does add a nice touch.

Some other things are still a little rough, like some blank animations for certain attacks (like Cinder attacking with a staff or some of the troll's animations), and some of the voices could use work.

Another point that I think most everyone else has already addressed is that it's very difficult to find other players...I spent 5 minutes waiting in the queue and found not a single person, so I decided to just mess around in practice matches, which still level up your profile fortunately.  It would be nice if the prices were slightly lower on some items, as they seem unattainable without grinding for several hours.  Perhaps a few more starting characters would be good as well (one for each class/play style?), each with a backstory and a unique personality.

The graphics and the character designs are all very nice, and I wonder if the developers will add customizable appearances (such as the skins" in LoL) later (cosmetic changes
hoursPlayed: and hopefully everything will be smoothed out before the release.\n\n-Sandi"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was recently invited to the beta, and i can say right now, even with all the problems the game has, i am thourougly enjoying it. It is Unique, fast paced, and an absoloutely beautiful game. the creators put a lot of work into it, and it shows.
it truely is a spooky themed game. every breed seem's valid throught all stages of the game, all roles have their use, and i absoloutely adore how the diety's work. the artifact system is so unique it's one of the things that drove me to sign up for the game. the breed's feel unique, and look the part to. the dungeon's are entertaining to dive into and take the loot to upgrade yourself with, and wearing items is the coolest thing i have ever seen in a moba. but, along with the good, also comes bad. time to get into the darker side of this game. the movement does not feel very fluid, and the combat can become very one sided, pretty early on. some heroes are slightly unbalanced, as i find corpus to be a little silly when he get's a bow artifact. it requires 2 or more people to kill one person as a general rule, sometimes 3, and the fact that corpus can solo just about anyone except tanks is very rediculous. and since you have to buy, or save up coins to unlock new breeds, some people can't counter him. ranged is FAR to powerful compared to melee. either buff melee or debuff ranged, the unbalance between the two is rediculous. some breeds abilities feel like they don't have any real use, or are just to much of a pain to cast. for example, Nekros's ultimate reanimates anything you killed to fight by your side. but it is point target, and you cannot select corpses and they despawn very fast. it is such a painful ability to use i have given up on his ultimate completely and just spam his E. and Nekros is just an example, there are more examples. next, some skillshot abilities feel like they do not have enough impact. surem, they deal fair damage, but late game they are pointless as the damage can be outweighed by a couple of right clicks, and the cast time is not worth it. there is no real hotkey customization, and you cannot traverse the map with the arrow keys, a feature i find a staple in most MOBA's. now, the resource system is VERY unique, but it is a bit of a pain. having to wander around the map can be bothersome at times, and there is only one bloodstone that respawns slowly. the crux should have more HP, as it can easily be solo'd which beats the point of it being a team game. the artifacts have to be bought like heroes, or save up to get, which i find stupid. sure, you can use keys to unlock them for one game, a day, or even a week, but not all are able to be so, and having to pay for the right to buy an over powered item in game is rediculous. it just adds to the unbalanced nature the game can have at times. now, i still love playing this game, despite all it's flaws, and believe me, it has many flaws. but these can all be fixed, and quite easily might i add by a bit of balancing. maybe decrease attack speed of ranged, or decrease damage. make skillshots more powerful, make corpses targetable... add hotkey support... the beauty of the game is that it is still in development. and if it were not, i would probably rate it poorly from a reviewers standpoint, even though i do enjoy it. but i see so much potential in this game that it i can't wait to see the finished product. i suggest you pick this game up, as i am sure you will have as much fun as i will. thank you for reading my review.

reviewText:
This is my first review, even though I have thousands of hours played and hundreds of games in my Steam library and elsewhere.

This game needs *a lot* of work, but I have to give it a recommendation out of principle alone. For the amount of rehashed, money grabbing MOBA/ARTS games on the market this is not one of them. They are actually trying to do something new here and even though I feel like there are quite a few fixes that need implemented I *must* recommend this to people who want a fresh take on the genre and not just another Dota clone. It is worth trying out just to see that there is potential out there in a watered-down, mobile-port-filled sea of boring.

The atmosphere and art style are very nice, the game has a lot of good things going for it. A bit of polish and tweaking and it could be a really solid title.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR Version.  Has the potential to be downright awesome, but isn't yet.  Best bet is to wait for it to be F2P

Don't take the Unrecommend at face value.  Deadbreed has handled pretty well for me.  Granted I don't have a huge amount of playtime.......  From what I have played thus far....DeadBreed appears to be trying to be LoL and Dota at the same time.  It has a Tower-Base-Core attack system that mimics LoL to the letter, the creep spawning as well as skill use is pretty spot on too.    And while I have never played a Dota...I have been told that the Day/Night cycle which empowers different heroes at different times, is right out of Dota's handbook.

Now, multiple reviews trash this game as a clunky/laggy/bumpy etc. piece of crap.....but those can all be chalked up to the fact that this is an Early Access.  When I played I experienced minimal to irritating lag, and a couple animation bugs that soon fixed themselves....nowhere near game breaking.  My biggest issue was the fact that there is absolutely no way to check the control scheme.  Even though it handles like any other MOBA, I was fairly rusty and needed a while.  P gets you out of the shop window BTW.

GOOD THINGS!!  (There are some)
-DeadBreed handles fairly well considering its level of completion, and it shows tons of promise.
-The heroes look fresh to me, some of them don't quite hit the grim/dark/spooky bullseye that DeadBreed appears to be aiming for but Yin and Yang right?  (I was thrown for a bit of a loop at first though as two of the heroes' name sare Nekros and Corpus....and I'm a bit of a Warframe nut.)
-The ability to buy gear before the match has started is really nice.  One thing I found difficult about LoL was that I needed to do things to get money to buy a weapon to be able to do things.....Plus you can actually see the weapons and armor you equip.
-Boss Fights......freakin boss fights.  And I'm not talking about Baron Nashor.  These guys are badass.  Killing them requires good gear a few players and some actual skill.  Plus, praying to them (fighting with them as your selected boss) makes them better!!!


All things considered...DeadBreed is far from perfect but has a definite chance of becoming awesome.  However Buying Early Access for a game that will be F2P is only for the hardcore..a mistake I made.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My previous review has been removed and re-written to reflect changes made to this game.

There have been some additions to this game and while it is still early access we are beginning to see it take some shape.  Unfortunately I still do not recommend it.

The biggest problems I feel are design decisions at this point and not neccessarily related to the state of the game.

First of all the complexity of the game.  You have levels, you have  a gold resource and then you have three more, nectar, blood and I believe essence.  These are collected different ways (blood and nectar found on the map and the third by killing creeps).  The problem here is it's just a mess, you can fight over these limited resources, but there is a lot going on in the game already and I don't feel it adds in any way.  Furthermore these resources are used in different ways including some champion abilities which i might add, are not great to begin with.  One ability that requires nectar to use sets a flower on the map that acts as a mine, but it does not provide warding and all it does is damage someone who gets too close to it.  Really not that sweet for all the cost of using it.  Worse yet?  Abilities do not appear to scale.  This means abilities (like that mine I was talking about) is quickly useless.

Winning a game requires defeating a boss monster but this monster has a ton of health and even a dominating team can expect to have to assault it multiple times to win, especially since it does not scale with the team size it is up against.  This completely removes the purpose of having 1v1, 2v2 matches when the boss monster takes for ever to kill in those cases.

I wanted to like this game.  I liked the smaller team sizes and I liked the darker aesthetic.  The graphics and sound is nice too, but the actual game play is just over complicated and in ways that detract rather than add to the experience.

It is still alpha so certainly a lot can still change, but at this time it is looking less and less likely this game will end up being a competitor in the genre.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI realize this game is in alpha but even still... it's a mess. No free hero rotations im stuck playing as one garbage character named corpus and his skill set doesn't even reflect the way you should be able to play as him. He's a mage but his skill set is basically that of a melee character. His stun is horribly bugged. If you throw it one way it will go the complete opposite and probably miss. There is no Smartcast function so for ppl who tend to use Smartcasting like myself, good luck to you. Character's mana pools allow you to use abilities once maybe twice. I'm almost convinced Corpus doesn't have an ultimate cuz it did nothing when i activated it. (Ultimates are available at level 6 like the Moba standard.) If someone dives you under turret you half to get the last hit on them so if you get killed from a turret dive and your killer dies to turret they are not penalized in any way and you get nothing for it. The game looks great I'll give them that... but they really should fix all the bugged gameplay before they try making a landfill of problems pretty. Give me the ugliest looking game ever but as long as it plays well I won't mind. Maybe my standards are too high after playing Dota, LoL, Infinite Crisis, and Dawngate. I truly fear that this small team of developers may be wasting their time with their competition. I truly hope this game does well because it looks great if only it had the gameplay to match it. I may have been a bit harsh in my review but I truly do hope that this helps... I'll probably play this game periodically to see if it gets better but for now go play a free moba, cuz this one is not worth your time right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I play the practice match as part of the tutorial. The controls were clunky but that's to be expected from indie developers. I'm sure later updates would fix that. So I kept playing. The AI was horrible, it was like a toddler was given a keyboard. But that's forgiveable too - single player was not the intent of this game. So I finished wrecking the bot and I tried my hand at pvp...

It took fifteen minutes in queue to find 5 other players to play with. And once the game started the true nature of the mechanics were revealed. Did you know if you shoot projectiles, and you move before the projectile fully gets to the target, it just vanishes and damage is never done? The players I played with were all brazilian so we could not communicate, but that's okay because you don't actually have to take towers or defeat the final team boss to win the game. You just have to run a flag back and forth. And since the rules aren't explained well nobody tried to stop you.

All in all a disappointing play. 1/10, would not play again.

reviewText:
Well, I really wanted to give a good review to the game but I jut can't because of the so many bad aspects the game currently have.  I hope I will have the opportunity to come back in a month or two and change it to a positive one.

I mean, I like the game and will continue to play it occasionnaly in hopes it will change/evolve to another state but I can't guarantee this will happen.  Don't get me wrong, the game have a good parts and I will all describe them but the negative aspects counter-balance the positive.

First, the pros.

1 - Very good looking.  The game is beautiful and its atmosphere is awesome (gory, dark).  One the best aspect is that your equipment actually appear on your character which is a thing that don't happen in most (if not all) other MOBAs.

2 - Multiple maps.  The game have three maps that offers different strategies which is a really good thing.  You can enter digeons to grab cash for your equipment and points for the team victory.

3 - Fluidity.  Even on my computer-slug the game runs pretty fine for its good graphics.  The programmers have done a good job.

Now, the cons.

1 - Pay-to-win.  The game is not really free to play.  Of course, you can enter the game and play without spending money but you will lose a lot.  The model used is that you have to pay for almost everything ; from changing your staring gear, getting cool icons for your profile or particularly to get ''stars'' to boost your characters so you will be competitive with other players.  Many things can be bought with in-game cash (Characters, Artefacts) and you get some ''stars'' by leveling but the grinding is too slow and you will be stuck with one character and bad gear for a long time if you dont invest real cash.

2 - The community is very toxic.  As I didn't paid any money yet, my characters are under-average and I'm always behind other players.  This have for effect that they think I do not play effectively.  The fact is that they have access to better gear and boosted character (which I don't) really makes them think I'm rather useless if compared to them.  I have been insulted, reported, left alone, etc... just because I can't be as good as a premium player.  You will also have to face totally overpowered opponents that will even follow you to your spawning area and kill you as you respawn (WTF??).

3 - The battlefield view.  The game looks good but the visibility is cramped compared to other mobas (camera is too close to the character) and you are constanly moving the camera from all edges.  Targetting is also a problem and is not very efficient either you target friends, enemies, creeps or interactive objects.

4 - The game lacks the best aspects of other MOBAs.  A community must be populous so you will find matches fast and you will find opponents of your skill.  Right now, the pay-to-win system is cramping the community to a small number (which is a really bad thing).  Balance is not to the rendez-vous and  MOBAs need to be balanced so a player cannot get an advantage because of his $$$ and its clearly not the case here.

Overall... I would say that you should only play this game if you want to invest money or else you will just be left behind.  The game is basically good but Alas, as I said, it lacks in the most fundamental aspects of MOBAs : Balance.  I'd say that you should invest at least 50$ from start if you want to get efficient, have a few characters/artifacts so you can really have fun.

If the devs begin to hear the community they will maybe save the game but right now the game is almost unplayable for free players.  This will lead the game to its grave as the community will not expand and will stay too small.  Free players are the cornerstone of success (for reasons I have described up there).  Almost everyone will eventually pay but they need confidence their money will not be lost.

VISUAL : 8/10
SOUND : 6/10
CONTROLS: 4/10
BALANCE: 3/10
DIFFICULTY: Variable: Easy if you pay, hard if you go free-to-play
FUN: 4/10 (I guess its more fun to crush other players when overpowered rather than being crushed... but I don't know for sure).

OVERALL: 5/10 (Poor)

Give it a try, look at the options the game have to offer and make wise decisions with your starting investment.  The game is not THAT bad.  It just hides its true nature : Pay-to-win.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing a single PVP match in Deadbreed, I noticed that the game is unplayable in a normal PVP environment. Given the fact, that its EA nearly excuses it, but considering the fact that a game that is sold for quite some money, you would think the core gameplay works at least. Thats not the case in Deadbreed.

• Minion hitboxes are extremly tiny, you will miss clicking them at least 80% of the time.
• There is no XP and Gold gain whatsoever if creeps or the towers kill stuff.
• If you manage to kill stuff and you would gain XP, you sometimes outrange the XP gain range because your bow range is higher.
• No matter how stable your ping is, the game will lag.

I had the luck of getting a key for free, but even I feel betrayed on this. Don't ever pay money for this game, even if it would help the development.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really didn't want to give this game a negative review, I'd been looking forward to it for a long time but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't dissappointed and have to be honest in my review. These packages themselves are very expensive. £5 for the game but if you want the game with a single character unlocked it's suddenly £15? Otherwise you have to use your keys to temporarily unlock someone to play (None of this is explained to you in-game btw). Any game that you must purchase, having cash shop items within as well tends to be seen as greedy, especially in a game where you HAVE to purchase characters and items to actually play. It becomes a pay-to-win and being able to earn in-game currency at a tediously slow rate, to purchase these item doesn't change that. The keys, for example, are a horrendous idea. You have your copper (Earned in game) and silver coins (Paid for) so why not leave it at that? The addition of bronze keys to unlock items for the next game only, or silver keys 24 hours or a gold key to unlock item use for a week, sucks. All items should be available for us to use anyway, these uber" artifact items are a dumb idea anyway. It creates a number of problems:

1) If you own a single artifact you wish to use and someone else buys it before you
date: you're out of luck. No artifacts for you. Only one of any artifact item can exist at any one time
recommended: in a game.\n\n2) If you wish to play multiple characters with their own builds
hoursPlayed: you're probably going to need to have a number of artifacts unlocked for them which require many more keys to unlock. Likewise if you are playing a mage and your mage artifact gets bought
voteText: then equip your Tanky artifact instead? Then your team tank may have needed that item and now (s)he can't purchase it.\n\n3) People who play this game enough will earn plenty of copper coins
helpfulPercent: buy all of the artifacts to unlock them (Around 10-20 games to earn enough

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My Review for this game so far

+ Lot of customisation! cant get enough of it
+ Graphics are Nice and polished
+ lots of choices of Items so you can actualy play a MOBA without feeling just a Preset and build teh same items over and over!
+ Overall gameplay is great
+ Made dungeons work in a MOBA!!! Quite suprised if you ask me
+ I have nother negative to say about the community so far

Now the negatives:
- There are some cheesy animations in there (They might be gitches TBH)
- Minions feel like they are useless for example, if they are attacking you there is almost 0 indecation of them attacking you other than watching your Hp bar slowly drain, but dont let this stop you
- There isnt many Darkbreeds (heros) but then again each darkbreed has about 5 build paths so you wont get board quickly
- The UI is well......Not so user friendly, I mean you can navigate where you want to go fine, but it feels....Unfinnished.


Conclusion:
I recommend this game, as a League of legends, Dota, Strife, Smite and Dawngate player, This MOBA will tower over main stream MOBA's with the right choices and additions,

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing a single PVP match in Deadbreed, I noticed that the game is unplayable in a normal PVP environment. Given the fact, that its EA nearly excuses it, but considering the fact that a game that is sold for quite some money, you would think the core gameplay works at least. Thats not the case in Deadbreed.

• Minion hitboxes are extremly tiny, you will miss clicking them at least 80% of the time.
• There is no XP and Gold gain whatsoever if creeps or the towers kill stuff.
• If you manage to kill stuff and you would gain XP, you sometimes outrange the XP gain range because your bow range is higher.
• No matter how stable your ping is, the game will lag.

I had the luck of getting a key for free, but even I feel betrayed on this. Don't ever pay money for this game, even if it would help the development.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is another MOBA game that tries to get itself on the market, but the makers, as in all cases of MOBA failures, dont really care. The game has almost no changes for a long long time, the gameplay looks weak when comparing to Dota2 or LoL, the graphics at first might look nice, but one closer look and you see they are a little outdated. For more CONS of this game, the servers lag as hell even with good connection, the amount of players is so low that last time ive played this ive waited 25 minutes for a game. This game is in early access so you would expect many changes and new stuff being brought in by the makers but there is nothing, nothing at all, and for now it looks more like the makers of this abandoned it a long time ago.
