reviewText:
Early Access Review

Everything is badly executed in the game, although the ideas for the features were good.
You collect some blue, red, yellow tears and you insert them into places, never figured out where the blue and yellow go but you can summon trolls with the red ones. You have to drag and drop them into some stones, although you have to carefully read that.
The looks and feels are terrible, I mean, if this game came out 8 years ago, I still doubt if it had any success.
I never managed to get it to run fullscreen even though it said it was fullscreen.
You only right click to attack, you don't have attack ground, A is something else, some banner thing...
There's no explanation for anything... after you're in the game.

There's this cool voice in the begining that tries to show you around with tooltips and everything, but it doesn't cover even half of the important stuff. I could have figured out by myself what the big play button did. One good thing is that by default, after you press play, practice mode is selected and you feel like the game is telling you to try that first.

I guess it was both fun and frustrating. Fun to try a free to play moba I mean.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very good moba, after reading some of the reviews here, i really wanted to know what this game is all about and i was surprised to find a well made game, unfortunately it does need a bit of polishing but it's a great game and the costumization is great also the achievement of making your favorite character grow better by leveling it
So you don't get stuck to keep playing the same game, the same items and the same levels like in other moba as HON or DOTA, it's not just shop items.

The fact that you have to earn artifact weapons and be able to summon special totems to aid you in battle by also gaining it with game coins is a very cool way to make the game interesting and instead of a jungle there's a dungeon with monsters spawning around its really all cool, it doesn't run out of fashion since the gameplay is interesting.

The effects on abilities, i won't lie to you i've seen some really cool effects in this game there's all kind of things i still don't know what they do, like banners and some stone you can summon a troll to help you with, those really add alot to the fun and feeling of the game.

I saw in a preview clip that someone testing this game said that the shop was not friendly for it's users, well i find it better than some of the moba's I've been playing for me it was welcoming, there's a good accurate detail on everything you wanna buy and it's easier to choose from, one thing is bad - shopping does take a bit more time and thinking which can make a new player confused and slow to someone that is already used to it which can make a big gap between the two in the gameplay and character advancement.

One more addition to the shop is it's unlike other moba :
Once you open it it's really cool you see your character outfit like in a mmo rpg,
you are able to choose or switch like having an axe or a sword as a 1hd or 2hd weapon or either ranged weapon or a magic dmg weapon and also you can upgrade it any way you want, dmg dealing, magic dmg, skill dmg etc...

I really like this game and i hope to see more players playing it in the future, i'll end my review recommending peoples to get it and play it. it's really a well made game!

One good thing is that by default, after you press play, practice mode is selected and you feel like the game is telling you to try that first.

I guess it was both fun and frustrating. Fun to try a free to play moba I mean.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*review revision 6/5/2015*

I want to recommend Deadbreed, but in its current state I cannot.

The game functions like a true MOBA, I admit I am not as experienced with the genre as I should be. That being said, I will not review the game's mechanics.

I will however mention that the game thus far is poorly optimized, so poorly that trying to start a match in anything other than 1v1 causes the game to crash. I am unable to play with anyone in 2v2 or above due to this crash, and trying 1v1 with another player seems to make the game highly unstable.

So far I have only been able to play 1v1 practice" bot matches on the lowest possible settings while still keeping my native resolution.

For clarification
recommended:
Sp 1
Intel Core2 Duo CPU E8400 @ 3.00GHz
4096MB RAM
NVIDIA GeForce 9800 GTX+

I understand my system is on the verge of minimum requirements
hoursPlayed: but the game needs to be better optimized to suit the requirements listed. I should be able to play 2v2 or 3v3 without crashing after breed selection.\n\nFor anyone with a system similar to mine
voteText: it would be best to wait for more optimization and crash fixes before investing time and money into Deadbreed."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

God I want to like this game.
I really Really REALLY do.
But I don't. (as it stands today)

Pro:
DOTA clone that is, in my opinion, as good as the original
Love the gothic look (steam needs more of this)
Looks good in the set-up and OK in the actual gameplay
Still early access, so lets hope this just gets better.
Steam cards
Single, co-op & multi player
Large number of player options (locked in base game)
Fair amount of customization


Con:
Often locks up while going into a game
Limitied number of players
Free ... but pay to win.  You need money to get coins, money to buy packs, money to unlock the 99.9% of the game that is locked.
Obviously still in Alpha or early Beta, hopefully the devs will finish this.
Keys, coins, money packs  ... oh my.

Overview:
If you like DOTA get the free version and try it out.
If you don't like DOTA, don't.

Should you pay to get a pack? Hmmmmmm.
Yes to support the developers - No given the state of the game.

This is one of those games that I wish steam had a thumbs sideways (Kinda like & dislike)

Either way, definitely download and try the free version.  It really is a good unfinished game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

( I pretty much detest almost all moba games in general there just money pigs and filled with angry 12 year old rage quitting)

However this game stands out with the custom builds like tanking with a mage or casting with a tank

The overall atmosphere is dark could use a bit more Gothic in that area but overall I liked it

Try to ignore the costume skin area that really needs work and its just visual nonsense

Fighter and assassin jobs are odd each breed gets a different weapon only a few get bows ,spears ,maces ,blades or hammers

As you level you get bonus to make your breed a bit better to start each match and that was the best part

Artifacts are fun to build during a match and the wings are AWESOME just for sheer speed buff alone

Also there are artifacts that instant rez you  YES!!!

If you are getting ganked a lot you detour and raid a dungeon for points and exp

I like the fact there is no center lane if you recall the first release map for beta LoL you know it was more fun that way

Odd crossovers and blind alleys make for perfect ambush spots oh and the creeps are smart they will detour and zerg when a monolith is gone they will also switch targets if you pull an enemy past them

A monolith will always switch to a player if you attack and enemy defender creeps can be killed without a monolith turning on you

Anything is better than Dota or LoL I give this Two thumbs up I hope it stays around and grows

Early Access Review

Deadbreed is okay. Not a fan of how they implemented the coin shop into. You have copper coins, and silver coins. In order to buy any of the heroes, save for 1, you need to buy the with coins, thats kind of understandable(although you should have more than 1 unlocked) but the issue is with the amount of coins you need to unlock the. The good ones cost like 5400 copper coins, and you make very little per game you play. The hero customisation on the other hand is real cool. Finally a MOBA that lets you choose a hero AND customise is fighting class(Fighter, assassin, mage, tank).
Overall, I wouldnt recommend it because of the coin shop, only 1 toon unlocked at start, only like 10 people to choose from, I think even less than that actually, and the lobby cant go full screen.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good Thing : Love the aesthetic... and that's it.

Bad Things :
- Gameplay sucks, slow and very clucky with not sensation of epicness when you use any of your skills.
- Buying items is stupidly complicated for no reason and i really hate it because i actually like the idea of customizing my character while i play, but is not good at all this way.

SHITIEST THING EVER : I have to tried 4 times in order to finally get a game and the first 3 i got the four player to play against but there was always one that didn't manage to load the map... AND THEY WERE ALWAYS THE SAME 3 PLAYERS!!! Finally in the forth attemt it work but my partner just disconnect and i end up in a 2v1 forever...

Final thoughts : I seen this in countless multiplayer games that take on the creepy/horror" theme as their core identity... they all suck at giving a great gameplay experience that stand on its own and they can actually be played properly. The only one that really made its name was Requiem : Memento Mori and in the end is not really an amazing MMO but i did play it quite a lot and i might play it again if ever redo it with a huge update. In the case of Deadbreed the only thing i actually like is the trailer... i like the idea
date: the aesthetic and i was hyped when i saw it but the execution is very poor
recommended: from the lobby up to the gameplay everything feels cluncky and not even worth trying. I would love to play this game instead of Heroes of the Storm... if this game has a gameplay and matchmaking on par with HotS. And that's why i'm going back to HotS."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAfter playing two matches I can say this: Brilliant game, runs well on my potato of a computer at high and yet still looks amazing at low. reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll start off by saying that this game has the potencial to literally be the best MOBA ever made, thing is, the game itself sucks ♥♥♥.

I'm not sure if im gonna leave a thumps up after i finish writing this or if im gonna leave a thumbs down. i'll be as short as possible

I say this game has lots of potencial because its ideas are unique and the setting is just AMAZING( even though i don't like darkish settings this one is by far the best MOBA setting out there). The fact that it gives you the liberty to change your role during a match alone makes this the best gameplay feature i've ever seen in any game of the genre.

Pros:
+ Incredible setting with a dark atmosphere.
+ Your character's visual appearance changes according to the items you buy and the visuals of said items are great too.
+ Versatility in gameplay. You're not locked into one role per hero and can change your play style even during the match itself.
+ Seems rather balanced.
+ Heroes are diversed and unique.
+ GREAT graphics that don't weigh on your machine

Cons:
- So few players it literally takes ages to find a match, assuming the server doesn't go down.
- Matches have a run down clock" thing
date:
making the games locked at 30 minutes. After those 30 minutes the match ends and the team with the most points wins. This feature is total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.
- The toturial ♥♥♥♥ing sucks balls.
- It's expensive as ♥♥♥♥ing hell.
- Devs seem to not be working hard at fixing the problems the game has
- Literally the worse AI i've EVER seen since i've played videogames (about 10 or so years)
- Map is rather small
recommended:
not too small but should be bigger.
- The Queue for a match on this is long as ♥♥♥♥ and sometimes the game won't let you join a match after you've accepted it for some ♥♥♥♥ing reason.


So those were my 2 cents on the game. I decided that i will not recommend this game because of the lack of polishing on some of the game's most important things
hoursPlayed: like propper AI and better servers.\nI wish the studio behind the game were as large as valve or riot so that this game would get more players
voteText: it truly deserves atention. With more players comes more money
helpfulPercent: with more money comes more resources to fix the game.\nI hope some better devs pick up on this game in a few years
votesHelpful: making it the game this should've been."

Early Access Review

The game is still in very early stage of development, but feels really enjoyable. The most fun and well made feature is item system, that allows you to play each hero in different ways, will it be tank or fighter, mage or assasin

Lets make it classic with pros and cons:

+Seems like base for a good lore
+Item system
+Interactive maps

Bad:
-Early Access
It includes buggy and unpolished gameplay, lack of heroes and other little things, that shurely will be developed later, but just are not here yet.

I`m a veteran of moba-games and played, well, allmost everything in this genre. And even now Deadbreed is far better than majority of moba's. Would recommend, if you are into this setting, moba games with interesting mechanics and want to see game rise from pre-alpha"-mode to really enjoyable experience."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ENGLISH

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2mZwObo9cTE&feature=youtu.be
(video in German)

My first impression of “ Deadbreed “ is following...

Pros:

- not P2W, cause you don't get any advantages with ingame purchases
- mix of Rpg/MOBA
- runs pretty fluent , though it's a CB (closed Beta)
- looks nice , graphical
- ranked games are planned
- menu looks good , visual  viewed
- there is a match history ( which is not sure in a Beta game)
- autobuy items ingame , for beginners
- after you buy ingame equipment you can see it , visual viewed
- artifacts (something like runes/masteries in League of Legends)
- sentinels (something like Nexus in LoL)
- 1vs1; 2vs2; 3vs3 mode
- daily quests , for more ingame money

Cons:

- not really beginner friendly,however just for MOBA adept
- no tutorial
- just one map so far, which is not important cause it's a Beta
- weird key system , would be better with weekly rotations ( like in LoL)
- the movement of the camera/hero feels passive/sluggish

conclusion:

Register at “ http://www.deadbreed.com/ “ and watch my review , with the abovementioned link,
and play it even , instead of listening to other ppl.
That said most bad game reviews on Steam just sux , cause ppl are playing the games for just some mins/hours !


GERMAN

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2mZwObo9cTE&feature=youtu.be
(Video auf Deutsch)

Mein erster Eindruck von “ Deadbreed “ ist folgender...

Pros:

- nicht P2W (Pay to Win) da man keine Vorteile durch ingame Käufe hat
- Mix aus Rpg/MOBA
- läuft flüßig , obwohl es noch in der CB (closed Beta) ist
- sieht grafisch ganz gut aus
- Ranked Games (gereihte Spiele) sind geplannt
- Menü sieht optisch gut aus , übersichtlich , erinnert an “ Nosgoth “
- Match History vorhanden (nicht selbstverständlich bei einem Beta Game)
- Autobuy Items hilft am Anfang die richtigen Items zu kaufen
- nach Item Kauf verändert sich die Rüstung
- Artefakte (sowas wie Runes/Masteries bei League of Legends) vorhanden
- Sentinels (wie Nexus bei League of Legends) sieht wirklich cool aus
- 1vs1 ; 2vs2 und 3vs3 Modi schon vorhanden
- Daily Quests bringen zusätzliche Punkte um Heroes etc. zu kaufen

Cons:

- nicht sehr einsteigerfreundlich, außer für diejenigen die MOBA Games kennen
- kein Tutorial
- bis jetzt nur eine Map (was aber nicht schlimm ist , da es halt eine Beta ist)
- Key System ist komisch , lieber wöchentliche Heroes Rotation einführen
- die Bewegung der/des Kamera/Heroes fühlt sich träge an


Fazit : Registriert euch auf “ http://www.deadbreed.com/ “ , guckt mein Review auf Youtube an ,mit dem o.g. Link, und zockt es lieber selbst an als auf andere Leute zu hören, denn jeder hat eine eigene Meinung.
Davon mal abgesehen dass die meisten schlechten Reviews in der Steam Community nur entstehen weil die Leute das Game nicht lang genung zocken !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A little buggy, very unweildly interface, the grind/pay to win elements make it far inferior to true Free To Play mobas.   A sleeker, cleaner interface would do a lot to make the game more appealing.  The in game armory is very confusing.  I don't see a mechanic to deny creeps, although I may have missed it.   In a few hours of playtime I did manage to get a lot of 'practice' games in.

This game needs a lot of work before it's ready.  The customization options for the character classes are interesting, and I like that mechanic, but again, it's not very intuitive.  Only being able to access one hero at the start of the game is definitely uncomfortable, and the mechanic which allows you to temporarily unlock them is not satisfying at all.

Game developers that hold content hostage for money and still call the game 'free to play' are doing a disservice to gamers and this isn't a game element that should be rewarded.   I can't recommend this game as it is right now, but I truly hope it does become a game I can endorse in the future as it is unique and engaging as far as mobas go.

I'd really like to see this game improve.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I think given support, this game will be an amazing fresh take on the MOBA genre. Try it, tell your friends about it, support it! As far as traditional MOBA games go, League of Legends is, and probably will stay for the foreseeable future, my favorite, but this game brings a lot of things that are just new to the genre. It feels more like a competitive ARPG (think low levels in Torchlight or Diablo 2) than your standard ARPG. You can equip your characters with different weapons to change their base attacks, there are small dungeons around the map to explore filled with treasure, you don't even have to kill the enemy base to win. Doing things such as killing your opponents, collecting the neutral resources, or even capturing the enemy team's flag will net you points, and if the game timer runs out and you have more points, your team wins.

TLDR; This game is an ARPG/MOBA,it is fun, and you should try it.

There are 2 things that I hate in MOBA's
1. Time limits in games, no... just no. Let the game play out please, don't end it when the enemy behemoth hasn't fallen.
2. Pay to win unbalance, Wait, your saying I have to purchase artifacts" with CC or SC so i can have final items in my builds? So if the enemy team pays money to purchase these items then they have access to stuff i don't. Its unbalanced before the game even starts and in a MOBA thats a problem.

Also
date: I give this game the award for worst animations ever. If you want proof
recommended: just watch the tower shoot its little tiny fireballs its hilarous."

reviewText: Incredibly fun and easy to learn. A fresh look at the MOBA genre. I do, of course, have suggestions for how to make the game better.\n\nAttack Move: Action Move does not function as attack move". Sometimes it's difficult to target
date: especially when the camera is locked to your Breed and an attack move function would be beneficial to these scenarios. Another place I would see it being useful is for characters like Corpus and Cinder who have dash/teleport type abilities. It always feels like the character model has to reset before continuing to move or beginning to attack which wastes precious milliseconds. So
voteText: everyone needs to make their cash somehow. However
helpfulPercent: the pricing scheme for artifacts
votesHelpful: skins
votesTotal: etc. feels a lot like League of Legends where everything is at least 5 dollars. Massive amount of content for a game that's only been out for 12 days. However
votesFunny: it's only been out 12 days. The player base is small and while the weekly keys are an amazing mechanic
commentsCount: it would be nice if pricing was toned down for now until you guys had a larger player base. It's hard to say "I'm going to spend the cash/the key on this artifact" when you know that for the next few weeks (at least) you're going to be waiting 10+ minutes per game.\n\nHit boxes: Need a larger hit box on all creeps. If my cursor isn't exactly on a model
column16: and this is for both creeps and heros
column17: I simply walk to the spot. This kind of ties into the attack move thing. You wouldn't need an attack move with larger hitboxes because it wouldn't be so dificult to actually hit things when you click on them rather than just running up next to it and chilling.\n\nBreed/Class select: We can see the breeds as people select them
column18: but have to wait to load in and then use our knowledge of the meta to figure out what classes are going to be fighting. This makes it somewhat difficult to construct a functional team. Just a little dagger for the assassin class or an axe for the fighter class somewhere on the breed portrait would simplify the hell out of composing teams.\n\nOff-hand slotting: If I click on my off-hand and buy an item
column19: I clearly want it in my off-hand. Whether or not I have anything in my "main" hand is irrelevant to me. This is the only aspect of the armory that has me kind of feeling "meh". I used some bronze keys for Malign and the lifesteal sabre and ended up not even getting to use them because I'm really particular about the look of my hero. I wanted Malign in the off-hand and had to sell it twice because it kept going into my main hand.\n\nFinally is balancing. All of the breeds I've played feel really good to play
column20: but with someone like Cinder you just pick up the first Blood drop
column22: and then proceed to outlevel everyone else playing the game. Of course I don't know ALL of the games mechanics as I just started playing yesterday
column23: but there are some Breeds that
column25: feel really scary to play. New game and all
column26: so it's not that big of a deal
column27: but there's potential for a veteran MOBA player to take serious advantage of certain Breeds/Classes and ruin the game for people who have never played a MOBA or aren't comfortable with the control scheme.\n\nAll in all there are some kinks that I personally feel can be worked out
column28: but the game itself is beautiful
column31: fresh. So you have to drop a few bucks to get the artifacts that really start opening up the game and the customization to you
column32:
but it really feels like a game with potential.

I LOVE THE DUNGEONS. I LOVE THE BEHEMOTHS. I LOVE THE NIGHT/DAY MECHANIC AND HOW IT INTERACTS WITH YOUR BREED. I LOVE THE ARTIFACTS. I LOVE THE ARMORY.

If I had stars to give I'd give it a 9.5/10. But I'm not IGN."

reviewText:
Not exactly my kind of game: I only played 'cause I got it for free and decided to give it a try not even knowing what to expect.
That said the quality is good, the atmosphere is cool and the characters, even if they lack a bit more background, are interesting. The tutorial kind of shows the basics so you can get through the first game and learn the rest as you go easily enough.
Also the characters and backgrounds are well designed and all of them have this dark twisted feel. I didn't play much but didn't find any bug, no bad designed controls or any other problems.
If you like league of legends or other similar games try this for a nice variation with a dark atmosphere and undead/mystical/demon characters. Just don't expect tons of diferent characters: there are about 15 of them.

reviewText: Deadbreed looks dead, 5+ minute queues. No thanks! Sad, since I do like the concept but the way to unlock things just seem too much at times. You have bronze keys (1 match) silver keys (1 day) gold keys (1 week). All could be gained weekly or through their in game currency or real currency. Keys are for temporary unlocks of whatever it is, from breeds to skins and weapons. Its rather expensive for skins, newest skins go for about 10-15 USD. Absolutely ridiculous but if you have that kind of money go spend it on a better game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello there everyone!

So, for a free to play eventually game it's not bad and you can really feel the free to play aspect already. It's kind of an odd mix of a lumpy Dota 2 + League hybrid that fails to really meet any valuable expectations one might have for a game of this caliber. I'm not saying don't buy it, I'm just saying if you really have to get in make sure you buy the cheapest pack for now as the game is far from ready to be in Beta. Combat is incredibly dim while not being as spooky" as advertised.

Creativity is the second name of the game. Do you equip this
recommended: spec into this or maybe the other one; lots of questions which is great! At the end of the day though the game itself just feels like a big waste of time that fails to really excite or wow the average player. Better luck in a few months when more content comes out!\n\nTl;dr: Check back in a month or two and maybe the game will have improved. Not going to judge any glitches as it's the first day it's been out."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a DOTA clone.. plain and simple...

I played a few games when it first came out and it's quite direct and fun.

There are a few things to note about this game...

Decent and dark graphics.. Yes it's quite well done.. each hero is unique, scary and dark in it's own way.
Fine combat music and sound effect. It's also quite well done. The enviroments are simple and easy to understand.
Tutorial lesson is needed! There are quite a few things that u need to learn from tutorial.
If u skip it like a DOTA Vetern. You are in a world of hurt very soon.

This game right now is quite heavy in the range of pay to win.

The base game is free.. but if you want to be successful and win all the time.. those payed dlc are must need.

Gold keys and other things can be unlocked by playing and winning but it's just so much simpler to pay and get better heros and items at start.. Quite unfair and will surely kill a lot fan base since 90% people are poor and stingy when there are cheaper alternative that's much more famous.

I understand developer needs more money to develop the game but I really don't think making another MMO would be a good idea to start since market is quite focused on 2-3 famous one already.

Like DOTA you do need a good team that know what they doing to win this and currently there are very few people in beta testing and it's hard to find a game.

The developer said they want to complete close beta by the end of feburary. I would encrouge them to at least remove half of the pay to win status at least and add more skins. Items and character are already cool and fun to use so you don't need to change any of that at least..

Who knows maybe we will get more people to play from this review.. maybe the game will be a bigger success when it's out of BETA...

Current rating is 7.5/10 but i would remove 3 points to 4.5 not recommend unless we can find more people to play this and cheaper dlc at least...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like Deadbreed, its a neat MOBA that I have know about for a while now but just got around to trying.  The art style is pretty great and the gameplay is unique enough to stand out from the crowd, its not clone.  The game does however have a few glaring issues.  One the UI is just terrible. it reminded me of an early 2000's or even late 90's UI. It just needs work. the UI is ugly and inefficient.  The bigger problem however is there are so very few people playing it. It has a very small community from what I can tell. So if you just want to play at any given time chances are it will be with bots unless you get lucky and find a game.

I would recommend Deadbreed to any MOBA fan to try, its not that bad and it needs more players.

5/3/15

reviewText:
Seems like cheap Fb game, maybe a little bit complex one ;

Pros
+ In my opinion only one thing that making this game a little bit diffirent from others is :  Presets . You can choose your role differently for each heroes. You can be fighter, assassin, mage or tank with only one hero.
+ Also there are  dungeons  in game. Yes, when you fight your opponents you can go to dungeon for getting more gold, exp or  key . (which giving you chance for trying new heroes)
+ You don't have to destroy enemy Ancient, Nexus , Crush or something else for finishing game. If you score more points before time ends you can still win. And there are several ways to do it ; gathering resources, carrying banners (Like capture the flag thing) , killing breeds.. But of course you can still finish it before time ends with killing  final boss which chosen with votes before match.

Cons
-  Grind for nothing.  Every game giving you like 50 gold something and you have to make it 6k for unlocking heroes , items or maps.
- Unbalanced heroes or Unbalanced matchmaking system or Unbalanced something.. You have to grind to get weapons which make you op, otherwise someone who had paid for it gona rekt you in late game.
- Combats not realy smooth. I'm not realy sure about what is problem but it seems like lacenty. My ping was not that bad. It was around 80-100 so i can't be totaly sure about it. It reminds me Fb games made with flash.
- Skills need more  detail and function. Stun, slow, knockback, maybe a little bit flashy aoe ulti.. but nothing more..

Anyway, nothing seems realy unique or special for now..

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, this could be a really good game. I don't really recommend it in it's current state, but it has a lot of potential and I don't want to make the recommendation statistic reflect poorly on the game.

Some pros and cons.

Pros:
The game is very original. It has a much MUCH darker feel than other MOBA's, and it uses some interesting new ideas, such as an RPG-esque shop and new resources to use.
The game is pretty fun. The game has interesting characters that can play many roles.
KEYS! This is a neat feature that, after logging in every day ([EDIT] week. You also earn keys in dungeons), you get some keys which lets you use an item for a short period of time (bronze allowing 1 match, silver for 1 day, and gold for 1 week). There still are permanent purchases with real/in-game money, of course. This is a good attempt to remove the P2P aspect.
The things that you do in-game affect you out of game. Doing dungeons get you keys (and in-game money, of course), putting blood in artifacts gives it permanent effects, and there are probably other featuers to be added.
Cons:
Small playerbase. Hardly anyone plays. This will change with time, of course.
Extremely confusing. The tutorial is extremely basic, and the game adds a ton of unique elements it really doesn't explain at all. Why is axe 1 better than axe 2? What do all these resources do?
Tons of locked content. This is alleviated by keys greatly, but a ton of things are locked and it makes the game difficult to learn.
Stupid AI. The AI for everything is very very dumb. The AI heroes facetank creepwaves for lethal periods of time, the trolls have strange priorities, and the creeps are extremely aggresive to the player (they also do very high damage compared to dota or league)
Overall, amazing game with fresh, new concepts, but it needs a ton of work. I would wait unless you really want to help the company improve the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Has a few new elements and features in the MOTA genre of games which are pretty good. Sadly though those great new additions are overshadowed by to many problems currently with the game. With so many MOTA games out there available that are free there is no way a new comer like Deadbreed should list itself as free and yet implement so many restrictions and lock outs on content.

If Deadbreed would like to continue to have such restrictions in the game they are going to have to offer a larger pool of available things that are free to even build up a community base of players. The lack of people on is also hurting the game as trying to match make even a 3v3 game is taking a long time if ever even formed. People back out of waiting only making it that much longer to wait.

Hopefully changes are made before final release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played this game on a weaker computer back in the day when it was still a fresh game. The FPS was running bad for me so I had to give up and uninstall. Now that I have a stronger computer that I built myself on a budget, I wanted to come back and try it out again. :( Sadly I've ran into another issue...the resolution of my monitor doesn't meet the minimum requirements (1280x768). What???? %$*&# >:( Yeah...that's right. They be reso-discriminating.... Out of all the high demanding games I play, this is the only time this has happened.


I guess I will have to wait until I get a better monitor before I play this game again. So that is the only reason I am giving a thumbs down for now.

Still don't regret going high on my GPU and CPU..

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I only started playing the game due to its looks and feel. I must say the game looks great and the gameplay is pretty damn great too, combinig an RPG style with MOBA to remove some of that boring stuff I hate about LOL and others.

However the game has one major flaw, lack of players, you will end up playing against the BOTS in Practice games instead of PVPing.

PROS: Great visual looking, I love the fact that when you buy an item you actually see it equiped on your hero, that new weapons, that cape etc. You can select the hero style before games (Mage, Fighter, Assassin, Tank)  no need to actually own 10 heores as your one will do everything you need. Make sure you buy the ones you want. Again the models and graphics are best MOBA yet.

CONS: Lack of maps, lack of heroes but see my pro point above, worst con is the lack of players, you can end up waiting 10 minutes without any luck, worst matchmaking in any MOBA as I can never get a mach, tried different times, after school, late night, weekends all with same result. Forced to play with BOTS which is very easy and boring like any MOBA vs BOTS.

I will casually play it and see how it develops. I really hope it picks up and more players will be on, more features and extras.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I noticed a lot of reviews before I bought it almost ran me off from getting this, but after playing it throughly instead of 0.1 hours like most of the reviews who dont even have a hour and talking bad about it, are doing false reviews for some reason or are just ignorant to what a MOBA is, this game is worth playing, everything can be bought via playing the game.

Amazing customization, animations are beautiful, spells and skills are unique to the breed.

I just got the death deluxe pack on the 16th and I was leary of spending on money a Early access especially on steam since every crook and fraud goes there now to make money on games they cant or never plan on completing and with some of the bad reviews I have to say after playing it for a few days, the game is really under advertised, this is a GEM , it plays super, the mechanics are great could some some shortcut hot keys but I am sure those are coming to make some things easier, but this game is amazing, I have hundreds of hours in DOTA and thousands in MOBAs and this one outshines everything, LOL sucks , DOTA and DOTA 2 are in the backseat here this game is great, I just hope they keep it up.

MOBA players dont have a clue what they are missing , this game needs more serious MOBA players it is great for a EA, I am suprised how nice it runs, the lack of bugs.

Right now there is 1v1,2v2,and 3v3 but I am sure larger maps and matchs are comming. The Dungeons and there are several that zone into totally different maps under the main map that are sperate dungeons, and are FUN as hell, very hard very challenging .

Each character has his own spells, skills and tactics for use, there is a top , bottom , and sort of middle except its more for the flag banner and harvesting power ups like blood, nectar and spirit is harvested from souls you kill (players/creeps)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has no chance to ever get on par with LOL, DOTA2, HOTS, and such.

So many things are bad, not working as expected, or outdated that it's boggling my mind how someone can go out with a game like this to gather feedback.

There is no attack move.
Controls are clunky, slow, unresponsive.
No smartcast. No smartcast in a MOBA, mind you. ROFL...
Bots (or who knows what) are talking all the time. I didn't find an option to turn this off. Gets very annoying fast.
Skills are mostly unoriginal and boring.
GUI is terrible. Takes too much space unnecessarily.
Lots of stuff doesn't work the way you would expect in a MOBA. And I mean it in a rather negative way, in this case.
Outdated MOBA rules / cliches.
Some graphical elements are nice to look at.
There's basically no reason whatsoever to delve into this game while there are incomparably better, more polished, and a lot lot more fun to play games out there in the DOTA genre.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nNow, Personally I came in with neutral feelings, because I'm a league of legends player. The first thing I noticed was how the characters skills transfer throughout ALL the weapons. Thats ok and all, but come on. It's obvious you want us to play a certain way. heres a simple idea. make the items you buy give you the skill set. (Like, a main weapon gives you all the skills, and a few stat buffs, and from there you upgrade everything else.) or somethign similar. don't stick us with pre-set characters, because that gives the entire game a very limited game-play feel. the next thing I found is that I have found ltierally no use for almost any of the yellow tear blood things, though the nromal blood is usefull, yellw and blue are so far almost completely useless. Another bit, the characters, I can see being locked untill you buy, but certain weapons? Thats kinda insane. you are basically telling us to pay to win. NOW, if you use my logic and make the weapons your skills, I can totally see the weapons being locked, and there being rarer ones, and all that. My thought unlocks a much larger ammount of potential and game style. Well, other than that, I did like the graphics and the darker scenery, just, the gameplay needs a major update. I hope you all use my thought on how it should be ran, and I feel if you do you guys will go a rediculously long way. keep going,  you are on a good path, just tilting a wrong way!

reviewText:
Okay first off... what just happened? Second off... what the ♥♥♥♥? And third off... huh? These are all questions I asked myself as I was rather brutally assailed by things that I was told I could hurt.
There is so much that just bombarded me, I actually think I want to press charges because this tutorial just assaulted AND battered me with what I can only assume is a deadly weapon.

Alright, let me level with you. Even if this game was the best thing in the world since the world was blessed with ♥♥♥♥, that still would not account for the distict lack of tutorial. I know that as an early access game, things are bound to be rough around the edges. But I would think that one of your first priorities would be the very thing that a player would first lay their soon to be utterly amazed eyeballs upon

I can see why people say it has potential, but if you can't design a basic tutorial, you have no business even releasing this to the public. A good tutorial is paramount, and this game doesn't even have a good one.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Huge potential  to compete with the biggest MOBAs out there right now.

The Good:
1.  The ambient  is dark and intriguing

2.  Characters are well built  in design artistically and in gameplay (which I'm referring to the skills that the characters use at least for early access.)

3.  The shop  for items is very comfortable and easy to learn (It has a button of auto-equip so it automatically buys the ideal equipment for your character.)

4. Has more than one possible way to achieve victory. (Which gives opportunity to the losing team to have a comeback, which I believe makes it challenging and awesome.)

5. Lets you decide and test, with Keys that are given weekly, the few characters that are locked and can't be played unless you spend the in-game currency to buy them. Upon starting the game you are given one free character, that is the same for everyone.  But with the keys given to you, weekly and a certain amount at the beginning of the game by buying it, you can test a few locked characters for either: one match, one day, or one week until you purchase them with the in-game currency.

The Bad:
1.  The game-play interaction:  the mouse pointer, the attacking, the movement of the characters are very inaccurate at times which makes sense now at least in early access but it just happens a few times throughout the game. Not all the time.

2. Very  few characters  to play with (Which again makes sense for its Beta-phase)

3.  The matchmaking  takes too much time for the obvious reason that not many people have it and those who do might not be playing it at the same time as you. Of course it can't be compared with League of legends" or "DOTA 2" at least for now... But It CAN be compared to "Awesomenauts" matchmaking PVP system and the pricing.

The Ugly:
Price.

Yes... the price is hurting the games potential but I
date: as a person who has a job and can afford to invest on an early access game so it can grow to be what it is meant to be
recommended: bought it believing in its potential and its developers. But you
hoursPlayed: as a steam user and consumer who might not be in the same as me
voteText: I would only recommend it for you if you have money to invest it in and
helpfulPercent: like me
votesHelpful: believe in this games potential and growth. Otherwise
votesTotal: don't buy it until it has come out of Early Access."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good points:
- nice atmosphere
- interesting gameplay

Bad points:
- some missing animation (but the game is still in beta, so I hope they will be fixed)
- too much locked content: sentinels, breeds and even items

You can unlock the content ingame using real-money, ingame currency (given e.g. when completing a match) or you can use a key to unlock something for a limited amount of time.
The amount of keys you have would be fine if you had to unlock only heroes but unfortunately you have to unlock items too.
Having only centains items available limits how you can build an hero and can be too great a disadvantage during a match.

EDIT: seems like you can't unlock most of the heroes and items with ingame currency anymore.
They just lost a player.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Deadbreed is a new kind of moba game that doesn't put it's focus on the amount of hero's, but on skill trough item building, and playing in a working tactic based on what you build. What i personally like as well is that items you buy will show in game as an equiped weapon or armor, with obviously makes you look more badass, which is nice.

The biggest difference with regular moba's i think is that there is not really a jungle area, although it has dungeons, which can be done in game whilst your team hold lanes. It really shows a new few on the tactic building, and the moba genre as far as i've seen. This also shows in the endboss, where, in order to beat the enemy, you fight i big monster, instead of shooting down a structure. which is alsno a new, yet very nice touch in my opinion.

All that being said though there is something you should consider: the game is still in Alpha, which means you will find the occasional bugg and glitch, which is simply a part of the programming process im sure. If you can't look past that, i suggest waiting before getting this game, because once it's done, im sure any will have a good time playing this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a TON of potential. It needs A LOT of brushup so far and ALOT of balancing and implimentation of some good musical score. Also, the window on the menu and whatnot before match, it makes the game feel cheap. There game itself is alot of fun, I wish there was alot more characters, more MALE characters, since almost the entire character selection is assassin looking females. But thats coming I am sure. Point is, if there was a game in the last several months I think is worth putting some money into for furthing development, its this one. Its a good break from the usual MOBA.
It mixes dungeon diving RPG elements from Diablo, with the MOBA feel above ground. And the change in base assaults is refreshing.
Definitely get it and give it a whirl. I will be playing it on and off, in hopes to see it actually get the attention it deserves and develop into something much bigger.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a Moba unlike any others out that i can find. The fact of the matter, When you buy items? Your heros has the actual items. I mean, Legitly you see the items you bought, and they look amazing.

Gameplay is smooth, though a little confused on how to Attack move, though im sure ill get it eventually.
Items are pretty self explanitory, and rather laid out okay. A Bit overwhelming at first, but take a few minutes in a practice match and youll find the shop to be pretty easy to navigate.
Objectives are rather unique and intuitive, and the Artifact system, Very Nice. Everything can be earned [Except skins, but honestly, who needs em when you can see the crap you buy?] The whole progressive rewards from game to game makes it even more interesting as well. So even if you did bad a few games, at least you got the ability to earn some rewards to make your next games easier.

ONLY DOWNSIDE ATM:
No Player base unfortunately atm, due to the fact this is so underground [yuk hipster words].

Im hoping it picks up quick. I Love the dark setting and the demon/angelic theme that is very prominant in this.
Give this game a try if your interested, the 30 minute tutorial gives you a very good break down of the game, and they allow you to unlock just about anything you want to try out, with no commitment to having to grind it out first.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first I rated this game positive, but that was before the 'lil event that happened and before I played the game a bit.

It goes like this:
*A bug occurs in game (where I lost a rank star due to a bug, and rank stars are like stat points in RPGs)

*I e-mail to the info@deadbreed.com and create a discussion under bugs section.

*No response to the thread from devs, and pretty late response to my email.

*E-mail says I won't get my star back because of how game is in a development state.

*I ask Will I get my star back when game releases or in any future patches of beta?"

*Their response is a no. It's just a small data change on their server and they persist on how they won't do it.

That's enough reason for me to uninstall the game. Thankfully I didn't buy any of their content and I'm telling this to everyone
date: DO NOT SUPPORT THESE DEVELOPERS. They are rude and lazy.\n\nThe only thing that's good about this game is the idea behind it. And seriously. That's the only thing developers did good anyway. Only thing I'm feeling bad about is the money I spent on this game's trading cards. Thankfully I only got to second badge."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

New, fresh concepts on an otherwise standard top-down MOBA. Early access - still needs polishment. Complex pay and unlock model.

Deadbreed establishes a dark atmosphere, and makes use of a day and night cycle. Apart from the last-hit money for buying items, it introduces three additional resources you can find on the map and minion kills. These can be used in conjunction with abilities or on the map.
Dungeons can be explored (including/mainly dungeon bosses). A capture the flag is in there as well.
The game using a count-down timer and if the enemy boss could not be beat the team with the most scores wins, is an interesting concept, making the time you will spend in a game much more predictable.

The Pay-Model is overly complex and thus confusing. There are three types of keys and two currencies. There are 5 or something types of stuff to buy or temporarily unlock - heroes, items, ranks, …

The game is early access, and you can see it’s not ready for prime time yet. Missing polishment in usability and understandability.
The main problem I see is that this very complex game has such a high learning gap on entry, that few people will actually want to invest into it when there are already Dota 2 and LoL, which people likely know, have friends playing, or can learn easier.

I’m not really a top-down MOBA player, but control- and gameplay-wise, this is not worse then the others. So it may still become something interesting and fun for those that enjoy top-down MOBA.

Early Access Review

This game has a TON of potential. It needs A LOT of brushup so far and ALOT of balancing and implimentation of some good musical score. Also, the window on the menu and whatnot before match, it makes the game feel cheap. There game itself is alot of fun, I wish there was alot more characters, more MALE characters, since almost the entire character selection is assassin looking females. But thats coming I am sure. Point is, if there was a game in the last several months I think is worth putting some money into for furthing development, its this one. Its a good break from the usual MOBA.
It mixes dungeon diving RPG elements from Diablo, with the MOBA feel above ground. And the change in base assaults is refreshing.
Definitely get it and give it a whirl. I will be playing it on and off, in hopes to see it actually get the attention it deserves and develop into something much bigger.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a Moba unlike any others out that i can find. The fact of the matter, When you buy items? Your heros has the actual items. I mean, Legitly you see the items you bought, and they look amazing.

Gameplay is smooth, though a little confused on how to Attack move, though im sure ill get it eventually.
Items are pretty self explanitory, and rather laid out okay. A Bit overwhelming at first, but take a few minutes in a practice match and youll find the shop to be pretty easy to navigate.
Objectives are rather unique and intuitive, and the Artifact system, Very Nice. Everything can be earned [Except skins, but honestly, who needs em when you can see the crap you buy?] The whole progressive rewards from game to game makes it even more interesting as well. So even if you did bad a few games, at least you got the ability to earn some rewards to make your next games easier.

ONLY DOWNSIDE ATM:
No Player base unfortunately atm, due to the fact this is so underground [yuk hipster words].

Im hoping it picks up quick. I Love the dark setting and the demon/angelic theme that is very prominant in this.
Give this game a try if your interested, the 30 minute tutorial gives you a very good break down of the game, and they allow you to unlock just about anything you want to try out, with no commitment to having to grind it out first.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lets Take a look at this for what it is; An early access Moba

Now, the Good:
1: Moba with heros that can play any class, any style, and are visualy customizeable

2: Wonderfully dark atmosphere, with killer graphics for what it is so far

3: Easy game play that rewards players for being  atleast Semi-intellegant.

The Bad:
1: Its a MOBA, meaning Yeah, people with money in hand, will have the bigger badder heros and gear before everyone else and dominate late game.

2: Although the class for the hero changes the skills remain pretty much the same, Sadly this means useing a Mage-ish char like Nekros or Corpal (right name there?)  as a tank will punish you with very bad skills for the type of game play you want.

The Ugly:
1: Currently its in Alpha, its going to be glitchy and buggy, and a tad messed up,  IF YOU ARE GOING TO WHINE ABOUT GLITCHES, DO NOT BUY UNTILL FULL LAUNCH OR LATER IN PRODUCTION, MAN UP AND GROW A BRAIN.

2: As stated above, it has its glitches and Qwerks, but im actually fairly certain its MENT to be played like that, its new and disorienting for those who are used to games like LEague of Legends or Smite, or Dota.  Doesnt play quite the same, Same concept, odd mechanics.

Overall:
Its a wonderfull game, hitting its first bumps in the road that it needs support to overcome, Write as negatively as you want, it has great potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well where to start....
First off the core of the game is to play MOBA with side of RPG elements. You play it as you would play Warcraft 3 map DOTA or the game with same name. But Deadbreed gives you an intriguing opurtunity to go dungeons and clear them for more xp and gold and keys (I will mention them later on). This is still an early beta indie game and I give my full support for it. I will recommend this game to 5 of my friends to try it out and we shall play few games to see if it met their standards. Deadbreed has a BIG potential.
To win  the game you must either : Kill enemy dude ( I dont know how to describe) witch is esentaly a giant monster in far end of enemy dungeon. Or win by time expiration of 25minutes and the points counted to determinate winner.
The game gives you 3 kind of resources to collect during the fight : Spirit - use it for items that are in category of totems"
date: Blood-get it from center of map or by killling enemy players and used to reinforce team by finding a skull and putting it in to summon a big creep in terms of stats and finally Nectar - activates "totems" (see bellow equipment)\nThe purchace system for opening new heroes is kinda uniqe and a bit of confusing. You can open new heroes by using silvers or coppers that you get for finishing the game. But! There is another way to open via keys. You get keys from clearing the above mentioned dungeons. Dont know how it works.\nThe thing that intrigues me is the equipment category. You can make your hero to be anything (mage
hoursPlayed: asassin) and the same hero will preform different ways depending the items you equip. You can equip special items that you buy with silver and copper for in game where they are called "totems" and you activate them with Nectar things during the battle.\nCurently you can play 1v1 2v2 or 3v3 PVP or practice matches so it seams that it aims to be a fast-paced MOBA
voteText: \n\nThe sad thing is that the developers are doing is to sell silver coins 2.50 euro for 450 silvers. Doing that in early beta isn't a smart move. A guy will pay 50euro and he will get 11000 coins to buy all heroes or "totems" so the new peopel will be overpowered with ease and will quit the game. I would recommend to turn it off for now. There is no community yet for the game to be greedy."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Deadbreed is an action online RPG with MOBA mechanics developed and published by Deadbreed, a Swedish gaming company. It’s a newly formed studio but the founding members and the development crew have tons of experience in the gaming industry. Some of the Deadbreed developers have worked on Just Cause, famous open world action title. Long time RPG fan and MOBA enthusiast, Stefan Ljungqvist (one of the developers) decided to make Deadbreed after realizing there isn’t an action MOBA with in depth role playing character customization. Players want to create characters with unique play styles but also original looks so cosmetic options are on the features list too.

Team battles are the core gameplay feature. There are no single player campaigns or solo mode scenarios. Players group up in teams of maximum 3 members and fight in 3 vs. 3 matches. It’s possible to fight against a computer controlled team but the best Deadbreed experience comes from PvP encounters. Hero customization and progression are 2 RPG features that deserve a closer look. First of all, there are multiple hero classes to choose from. There are nightbreed and daybreed heroes but also a mix called halfbreed. Archer, warrior and wizard are the main Deadbreed class archetypes. All heroes have unique spells and play style that can be further customized by equipping different items. There are items that boost offensive abilities and damage and also items to enhance hero defense. Armor is worn on head, chest, legs and arms. Heroes wield class specific weapons such as bows, swords and maces. Deadbreed has a very rich weapon selection. There are items that increase movement speed and consumables to provide short term boosts. Deadbreed allows players to craft and use powerful items known as artifacts that can be upgraded with relic slots. Artifacts lose durability when playing matches.

Hero experience is won by playing Deadbreed matches. Heroes level up after they accumulated enough experience, each level unlock additional perks like crafting features or wearable items. Deadbreed is a free MMO with original match mechanics. At the end of each match, players have to fight a boss chosen by the Sentinels, an NPC Deadbreed faction. Players earn reputation with the Sentinels and gain their favors to receive all sorts of bonuses. Matches are normally fought between 2 teams of 3 players but there are some features to make things interesting. Players are able to summon creatures to fight by their side. Battlegrounds have dungeons and a PvP quest system. Deadbreed has a dark fantasy visual style and gloomy atmosphere.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAbsolutely love this game for what is there so far. Unique heroes, very unique objectives, a whole new take on mobas. Jungling is replaced with small dungeons, and there are resources other than gold to collect to help you scale. Also, the acient/nexus/main base objective to win is A BOSS FIGHT! Your team votes on the boss they want for their side before the match starts and the enemy does not know what it is until they get to it. Also, the heroes are customizable. Like an assassin but want to play it more magelike? you can do that! you can scal more toward Assassin, Mage, Fighter, or Tank. Your heroes also wear the items you buy in the shop during matches, so you change as the match progresses. I highly recommend this game to anyone who wants to play a unique yet fun moba. Worth a try. The only downside is that basically noone is online ever, hence this review to persuade people to play it! 10/10 for what is there so far. Only occassional minor bugs like pathing issues but those will be fixed as the game goes on. Give it a shot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What a sucky game. This felt like a Diablo-style game that was could have been released as such but due to budget cuts, they decided to scam players of their cash by releasing it as a MOBA. Everything I see looks like it could have been Diablo but someone decided Let's scam players by calling it a MOBA"

PROS
1. Trolls
You can summon a giant Troll that hunts down other enemy heroes by offering blood from a Blood Tree (you have to collect a drop of blood from a tree) to a Troll Stone in front of the Troll Cave. Trolls basicallly function like Super Creeps in Dota
date:
high hit points and only 1 objective.

2. Dungeons
There are dungeons that you can use to fight mini-bosses

3. Sentinels
The final boss that you must kill is called a Sentinel which is a gigantic immobile Behemoth. Don't be fooled
recommended:
it fights back similar to Mephisto in Diablo. There are other sentinels but I've only seen Baal. It is actually harder to end the game this way as the bosses heal every new day.

CONS
1. Pay to Play / Pay to Win
You have to use silver (cash currency) to buy bronze
hoursPlayed: silver or gold keys to unlock the character you want to play for 1 hour
voteText: 1 day or 7 days respectively. There is only one permanent hero
helpfulPercent:
Corpus.

2. Empty
Really no one playing. You can't even get a Duo game.

3. Spelling Errors
"Aquire" instead of "Acquire"?

4. Item Shop / Armoury
Horrible interface. Some items are actually locked.

5. No balance
With a stupid idea like using keys just to play
votesHelpful:
you will never be able to balance the characters.

6. Nectar
Another silly idea
votesTotal:
now you have to go around the map picking up "Nectar points" for unlocking Artifacts.

7. Banners
You can steal your enemies' banner which is just outside his base
votesFunny:
to bring back to your base and destroy. For?

8. Barrels
You actually break barrels in this game to get +13
commentsCount: +17 gold. Worst
column16: the gold falls on the floor so you have to actually walk over the gold to pick it up
column17:
else someone else could take it. Items costs hundreds to thousands of gold.

9. Spell bugs
Certain spells can't be cast or used near Monoliths (towers) or when they are no enemies around. You will see a white Area of Effect Circle and the spell picture but you can't use it on anything or anyone."

It’s possible to fight against a computer controlled team but the best Deadbreed experience comes from PvP encounters. Hero customization and progression are 2 RPG features that deserve a closer look. First of all, there are multiple hero classes to choose from. There are nightbreed and daybreed heroes but also a mix called halfbreed. Archer, warrior and wizard are the main Deadbreed class archetypes. All heroes have unique spells and play style that can be further customized by equipping different items. There are items that boost offensive abilities and damage and also items to enhance hero defense. Armor is worn on head, chest, legs and arms. Heroes wield class specific weapons such as bows, swords and maces. Deadbreed has a very rich weapon selection. There are items that increase movement speed and consumables to provide short term boosts. Deadbreed allows players to craft and use powerful items known as artifacts that can be upgraded with relic slots. Artifacts lose durability when playing matches.

Hero experience is won by playing Deadbreed matches. Heroes level up after they accumulated enough experience, each level unlock additional perks like crafting features or wearable items. Deadbreed is a free MMO with original match mechanics. At the end of each match, players have to fight a boss chosen by the Sentinels, an NPC Deadbreed faction. Players earn reputation with the Sentinels and gain their favors to receive all sorts of bonuses. Matches are normally fought between 2 teams of 3 players but there are some features to make things interesting. Players are able to summon creatures to fight by their side. Battlegrounds have dungeons and a PvP quest system. Deadbreed has a dark fantasy visual style and gloomy atmosphere.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Deadbreed is a new kind of moba game that doesn't put it's focus on the amount of hero's, but on skill trough item building, and playing in a working tactic based on what you build. What i personally like as well is that items you buy will show in game as an equiped weapon or armor, with obviously makes you look more badass, which is nice.

The biggest difference with regular moba's i think is that there is not really a jungle area, although it has dungeons, which can be done in game whilst your team hold lanes. It really shows a new few on the tactic building, and the moba genre as far as i've seen. This also shows in the endboss, where, in order to beat the enemy, you fight i big monster, instead of shooting down a structure. which is alsno a new, yet very nice touch in my opinion.

All that being said though there is something you should consider: the game is still in Alpha, which means you will find the occasional bugg and glitch, which is simply a part of the programming process im sure. If you can't look past that, i suggest waiting before getting this game, because once it's done, im sure any will have a good time playing this.

What a sucky game. This felt like a Diablo-style game that was could have been released as such but due to budget cuts, they decided to scam players of their cash by releasing it as a MOBA. Everything I see looks like it could have been Diablo but someone decided Let's scam players by calling it a MOBA"

PROS
1. Trolls
You can summon a giant Troll that hunts down other enemy heroes by offering blood from a Blood Tree (you have to collect a drop of blood from a tree) to a Troll Stone in front of the Troll Cave. Trolls basicallly function like Super Creeps in Dota
date:
high hit points and only 1 objective.

2. Dungeons
There are dungeons that you can use to fight mini-bosses

3. Sentinels
The final boss that you must kill is called a Sentinel which is a gigantic immobile Behemoth. Don't be fooled
recommended:
it fights back similar to Mephisto in Diablo. There are other sentinels but I've only seen Baal. It is actually harder to end the game this way as the bosses heal every new day.

CONS
1. Pay to Play / Pay to Win
You have to use silver (cash currency) to buy bronze
hoursPlayed: silver or gold keys to unlock the character you want to play for 1 hour
voteText: 1 day or 7 days respectively. There is only one permanent hero
helpfulPercent:
Corpus.

2. Empty
Really no one playing. You can't even get a Duo game.

3. Spelling Errors
"Aquire" instead of "Acquire"?

4. Item Shop / Armoury
Horrible interface. Some items are actually locked.

5. No balance
With a stupid idea like using keys just to play
votesHelpful:
you will never be able to balance the characters.

6. Nectar
Another silly idea
votesTotal:
now you have to go around the map picking up "Nectar points" for unlocking Artifacts.

7. Banners
You can steal your enemies' banner which is just outside his base
votesFunny:
to bring back to your base and destroy. For?

8. Barrels
You actually break barrels in this game to get +13
commentsCount: +17 gold. Worst
column16: the gold falls on the floor so you have to actually walk over the gold to pick it up
column17:
else someone else could take it. Items costs hundreds to thousands of gold.

9. Spell bugs
Certain spells can't be cast or used near Monoliths (towers) or when they are no enemies around. You will see a white Area of Effect Circle and the spell picture but you can't use it on anything or anyone."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAbsolutely love this game for what is there so far. Unique heroes, very unique objectives, a whole new take on mobas. Jungling is replaced with small dungeons, and there are resources other than gold to collect to help you scale. Also, the acient/nexus/main base objective to win is A BOSS FIGHT! Your team votes on the boss they want for their side before the match starts and the enemy does not know what it is until they get to it. Also, the heroes are customizable. Like an assassin but want to play it more magelike? you can do that! you can scal more toward Assassin, Mage, Fighter, or Tank. Your heroes also wear the items you buy in the shop during matches, so you change as the match progresses. I highly recommend this game to anyone who wants to play a unique yet fun moba. Worth a try. The only downside is that basically noone is online ever, hence this review to persuade people to play it! 10/10 for what is there so far. Only occassional minor bugs like pathing issues but those will be fixed as the game goes on. Give it a shot.

Early Access Review

Good points:
- nice atmosphere
- interesting gameplay

Bad points:
- some missing animation (but the game is still in beta, so I hope they will be fixed)
- too much locked content: sentinels, breeds and even items

You can unlock the content ingame using real-money, ingame currency (given e.g. when completing a match) or you can use a key to unlock something for a limited amount of time.
The amount of keys you have would be fine if you had to unlock only heroes but unfortunately you have to unlock items too.
Having only centains items available limits how you can build an hero and can be too great a disadvantage during a match.

EDIT: seems like you can't unlock most of the heroes and items with ingame currency anymore.
They just lost a player.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am writing this review while considering this game is still in development so I will not complain about bugs or anything. I gave a thumbs up for now if the issues I'll mention is not fixed or changed regardless of my vote I believe this game will be a failure.

Lets start with positive things;

I am really liking this game so far because it has an excellent atmosphere, well made hero designes and a lot of ways to win. You can capture an enemy banner, collect stuff from trees, kill enemies, bring down towers... These all will give your team points to win the game. If no one can bring down the enemy boss in 24 mins, team with the most points will win. This is also great because it prevents the game from being too time consuming. I also liked that you can choose a role for your hero at the start of the game and make your own play style with that hero, rather than heroes having specific roles like in dota 2 or league. Another part that I like about the game is that the items you buy actually appears on your hero which is nothing more than a visual but it greatly improves the atmosphere. There are dungeons instead of jungles which I find very creative and likeable. The game can consist of 3vs3, 2vs2 or 1vs1 which makes it less overwhelming and it seems there are going to be more maps than one which is always good.

Before getting to the negatives I want to mention the playable hero system. The hero system is like LoL's champion system, meaning you have to buy the heroes you want to play. Although I don't find that system very nice, this game actually allows you to try the hero out before buying it by giving you keys that will make that hero available for a time. This system applies to every purchasable item in the game which is much better system than LoL's weekly champion cycle. There is also a quest system which in return gives you copper coins to buy new heroes or other items which is also very nice.

Now going on to the negative sides;

I mentioned dungeons in the positive sides, though they are nice and all, after you kill a camp of creatures you get to open a chest that is guarded by that creatures, there is usually gold inside which is fine but sometimes it gives you copper coins which are used to buy heroes and stuff or keys to try out heroes. This is where the greedy side of the game comes into the scene. Those keys or copper coins don't effect the winning or losing in anyway. they are only there to make you want to buy things. Instead of this I would recommend giving a small amount of free keys weekly to every player. For the copper coins; you can already get them by playing the game or doing the quests so you dont need them to come out of chests. Another bad side is that there is only one free hero. The reason for that might be the very limited count of heroes which is expected because this game is still in the process of making, but still there should be atleast 3 free heroes so everyone can pick something different. There is no denying your own creeps or towers, no creep deny is fine but since the demolition of towers give points to the teams a tower deny mechanism that will prevent the enemy from getting points would be great to see. Also the thing about towers is that they actually one shot some creeps, so there is no way for you to get gold from them, it is irritating for me. The spider boss, equivelant of Roshan in DotA and Nashor in LoL, is too weak. You can kill it on your own with some medium level items. Dungeons are too small, they only have 3-4 camps. Now the biggest problem is the artifact system the game introduces. Artifacts are cosmetic items that actually effect the ingame, again as I said; greedy game. After you fill your item slots, if you don't have artifacts your gold is no use. People with artifacts will have better and more items than you do. I would be fine with it if they were cheap like runes in LoL but some of them are as expensive as heroes themselves. Thus, game becomes pay to win. Some people tell me to use the keys to unlock artifacts but as you know, keys are limited. So the better way to overcome this would be making the artifacts cheaper. Another problem with artifacts is that they are very very powerful. So I would recommend limiting the number of artifacts a hero can get to one artifact only.

Overall I give that game 6.5/10, it has real potential to become a great game and I would hate to see it go to waste so please consider my suggestions.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nNeeds some work, but the MOBA has a nice bit of thematic charm and some interesting mechanics. The ability to play a character any way, which will also change up their animations (choose a bow and your animations follow suit, swap to a sword and shield, that changes things too,) makes it quite different from other MOBAs I have run into. You are able to do what most MOBAs allow- buy content with in game currency as well with real life money. This allows you to purchace artifacts (weapons, shields, etc,) as well as characters, so everyone has access to all of these in due time. It's not a pay to win system. It's no League clone, it is a very different breed of it's own, and I'm hoping it will continue to grow into something great.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

·HUGE Potential!
·Long way far from finished. (The Devs say it will soon be at a 'Release State' but I believe otherwise - Maybe CBT at best)
·Unique features (such as: your character's appearance change with the equipment you buy, change your role according to the equipment you are wearing - even at the middle of a match, buy equipment with unique skills each, gameplay changes according to your Sentinel (Guardian - Final Boss) which you and your team votes for, GREAT visual effects and much more, It is not your typical MOBA) plus Dark freakin' atmosphere, which make this my best MOBA by far.
·BUT the game needs more Devs and a LOT more Players. (maybe merge the f***ing servers till we actually get a big player base going)

I play it off and on when there is an update...there is one every 5 months or so...... 10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

|__Honest First impressions Summary__|
This comes off as a DotA/LoL meets Diablo: a MOBA with some Dungeon crawling and the dark style of the game itself. I've yet to see the absolute pay-to-win mechanic that people are talking about, as using real money buys in-game currency so you can purchase items that everyone else actually has access to otherwise. The UI could use some work, but it doesn't break the game at the least. The game is still buggy though, as playing as Cinder, I couldn't use her W during the second match I was using her for absolutely no reason at all. What I really like about the game is that while each character has a default play-style, it's not locked to play that style: each character can have it's loadout changed from Warrior, Tank, Assassin, Mage, etc. The Monoliths (towers) aren't incredibly OP because they do not autolock when your fighting someone under them, but can be unforgiving when the mobs are clear and you're all that's left. The added aspect of the Sentinal is a slick idea, so it's as if you fight a boss at the very end to finish the match out and win.

All in all, I'm surprised more people don't play this as I find it really fun to play.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An unfortunate factor is the game is very new and there aren't many players yet.  Waiting in que for a match is very long. Most times you'll notice you are the only person in the que, or at least I did.  The movements and attack mechanisms are not fluid enough, it has some excellent ideas as far as separate rooms for monsters, and activating nps to fight for you. The morbid concept is actually pretty cool and very different.

To sum it up...

The community needs to populate more.  Hero movements and attacks should be a little more smooth and blended. The lobby is cluttered and feels disorganized.

Not a big or complicated list, it could be a very fun game to play

reviewText:
Honestly has potential to be a good MOBA.
Few things I wanna say to the developers:

1.PLEASE make the hitboxes big enough to be able to actually click on
2.Make the laning phase balanced somewhat because the creeps/minions have no aggro whatsoever people that start         with ranged weapons can harrass melee users with no penalty
3.Remove the time limit, it makes the game feels somewhat rushed and you can't enjoy the time you have in that game
Instead, what I would suggest is that you lower the behemoth's HP and make it somewhat killable if two farmed breeds
are attacking it even without minions, or the first to 100 points win. Don't make this into a Dota 2 Overthrow Mod.
4.Needs more unique items than just pure OP stats like massive armor pen and damage
5.Balance Frost Gemini... A skillshot that does half of your hp with massive range and EVEN splits, an aoe dmg overtime that heals 45% of the damage dealt?! And a buggy as hell ice wall... Her ult is actually fine.

That's my current opinion as I make this post, other than that, well keep up the good work :D.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nall-though the search for players on pvp is rare, the pve makes up for it.... some tipps and ways to subdue the bots without fail; first youll have to win a few matches in pve then somewhere along the lines you`ll get 400 silver coins now what you should do is buy an artifact with it, for instance i use the haunted blade, which drains life per hit, plus 10 attack rate and plus 60 damage attack... anyways, the all the artifact weapons and gear can be socketed.. after successfully socketing an item youll beable to level it up adding along the way plus points to whatever gem you inserted.... now what i do to get that upgraded weapon as fast as possible is start up 3v3 and save til i have enough )note killing the creepers can be useful( so as soon as youve purchased, equip a helm that has a fast attack rate and buy the cape as well... all else doesnt really matter, theres two second hand items i personally use which is the spine blade )that also has a fast attack rate( and/or shield.. you should have no problems with any of the enemies and are even capable of double kill depending on skills.-fin-. overall this game shows a great deal of tactics and strategy along the borders of defending as well as attacking.. uniquely rare and to be proud of!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An unfortunate factor is the game is very new and there aren't many players yet.  Waiting in que for a match is very long. Most times you'll notice you are the only person in the que, or at least I did.  The movements and attack mechanisms are not fluid enough, it has some excellent ideas as far as separate rooms for monsters, and activating nps to fight for you. The morbid concept is actually pretty cool and very different.

To sum it up...

The community needs to populate more.  Hero movements and attacks should be a little more smooth and blended. The lobby is cluttered and feels disorganized.

Not a big or complicated list, it could be a very fun game to play
