reviewText:
Early Access Review

I tried to play this game - I really did.

Smooth gameplay, nice tutorial - if you don't have to do it several times because the game thinks you didn't do it yet - and interesting heros.

The thing that bugs me is: Every time i destroy the enemys crux, the game instantly crashes, like I am not supposed to win the game or even have a chance at it.

I've tried this in several games now, and the result was always the same: instant crash and restart from the beginning - with the annoying, easily confused step by step tutorial, in wich you have to click where it is reccomended, else the tutorial itself becomes useless and unusable.

3/10 for effort.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: I'd now say get this game ONLY to see it develop/see some innovations (if you have unlimitted data & storage space to waste I guess) or if you have friends to try it with you. Still not that polished & I haven't gotten a single PVP match (15min+ wait times) :| Total character pool is about as much as 1 weekly free roll in LoL & still only a few of them can even be 'rented' per week.

EDIT 2: Uninstalled a while back but I'm pretty sure it had never gotten an update while I had it, lol.

This is one very interesting game. I've tried a few different mobas too. If you're looking for a moba/RPG-style game give it a try. This review is kinda rushed after under an hour of playing the game - I've only played a 1-v-1 practice match & a 3-v-3 (normal) practice match. I've essentially gotten 'hints' about all the features of the game and didn't get to experience many of them indepth, largely due to its most controvercial feature of having a lot of (severe) time limitation.

Deadbreed has several interesting innovations - from the visuals to the business model - that seem to work and I think your overall enjoyment of the game (i.e. your decision to stick with it) would fall onto a couple of details that might be a deal breaker for you or would just up the challenge/depth. I think I would describe this game as a MOBARPG - a combination of LoL style gameplay (over DotA) and MMORPGs (the dungeons & instanced fields kind).

*TL;DR review (i.e. features) followed by (clumsy) details, then final verdict.
Main features:Fantastic graphics with a horrific-yet-interesting theme that runs very smoothly and feels polished. Fog of war is a little hard to identify though (until you see enemies). UI can be complex/deep but is non-intrusive.
Heavily narrated game (fully voiced tutorial).
Detailed & heavily modular hero models (better than dota 2's I would say). In-game shop items are visually equipped on your hero! (As if u're carrying Butterfly" or "Infinity Edge" as your weapons in DotA/LoL)
3-v-3 matches with 2 lanes & 3 towers per team
date: followed by 1 boss to kill behind enemy lines to end the game (like Dawngate). Tower damage & health are not very big. 3 additional dungeons per map.\nInventory consists of slots for head
voteText: left hand and lower body (this might be consistent or it might differ between some heroes
helpfulPercent: I'm not sure). The item shop in a match looks like a character equipment screen in an MMORPG.\nPlay any hero as any one of four roles - assassin/fighter/mage/tank - and switch as you please in-game according to the items you equip E.g. Choose "fighter" to start with a sword and a shield
votesHelpful: then mid-game sell your shield for a second sword & buy equips accordingly to become assassin~ Some 2-handed weapons.\nCosmetic skins make the hero models look very different (e.g. skeleton ver.
votesTotal:
gothic ver.)
Limited creep models (as far as I know)
Sound effects aren't particularly interesting/exciting (not-so-epic battles)
Bots are quite ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ & pathing is not the best.
Controversial features:The limited pool of heroes is locked (except for 1). Unlock the hero temporarily with bronze key (for 1 game

column20: weekly 1 I think). You can also buy the hero for permanent access. These keys (at least bronze) can also be found in-game in dungeon chests (I had to use one for the tutorial
column21: then I found one in a dungeon by chance).\nMatches are limited to 24mins
column22: after which gameplay is ended & a victor is announced according to team's points.\nThere are a few in-game shop items that are only accessible after they're unlocked (bought?)
column23: whether they're unbalanced or not I dunno.\nHero must be unlocked for practice mode (i.e. 1 single-game bronze key unlock will be used up to practice with bots unless hero is already unlocked
column24: you will be notified of course)
column25: but you will get rewards from bot matches too.\nDETAILS ||\nSetting/theme/aesthetics/graphics...visuals I guess(?)The aesthetics of the game are already something that might deter some. From the thumbnails I felt it looked quite dull
column26: unlike many vibrant-coloured counterparts available out there (after all
column27: vivid colours are healthier for your brain while greys are mind-numbing/make you dumber in the long run
column28: right?) but rather the game uses earthy colours and the maps have a nicely rendered netherworld feel to it complete with smoke particles
column29: elemental wisps & whatnot.\n\nI feel kinda dumb not getting the theme from the title. The heroes in this game are essentially zombies; they're various souls that have been resurrected into this nether realm to fight their way back to life (if I understand correctly thus far). Accordingly
column30:
the (2) maps I got to see are graveyards and the starting point/base shop are where your tombstones stand. This team base also seems to be very accessible by enemies but you will probably heal too fast to be pwned by them there at any point (probably).

GameplayIt's not easy for me to seperate every feature as most of them are related to each other but I'll try.

MAP & OBJECTIVES
It consists of 2 lanes that form an elongated circuit around the centre. The base is on the inside of either end of this 'track'. There is a tier1 tower on either side of the base (on each lane) and one tier2 behind the base. Behind that
column32: there is a locked door to be broken and a boss inside to be defeated to 'win' the match (like Dawngate - now closed). The centre of the map consists of a 'jungle'/labyrinth which contains chests
column33: stat pickups (more details in-game...) and 3 more doors leading to dungeons. The sad thing among all this adventure-liciousness is that you must complete the match within 24 minutes or have it cut short and the winner decided according to points collected thus far... this is the single strangest idea in this game. 24mins is just about enough time to rush the towers & fight the boss
column34: ignoring every other aspect of the game
column35:
if you're pwning...

BATTLES & SKILLS
The 2-lane 3-v-3 setup does make for a strange - if a little interesting - match up. You could essentially have 1-v-1 games on each lane while a third (maybe assassin?) player goes through the 'jungle' & dungeons and collects pickups/points etc. before the enemy hero does
column36: but you'll likely end up with many 1-v-2 encounters too (constant ambushes I guess).\n\nFighting mechanic is quite similar to LoL: quick-cast on by default (press the corresponding skill button to instantly cast it where your mouse pointer is) but without the OP passives on each champ; skills have many levels like in LoL
column37:
no seperate stat leveling (unlike DotA); items affect skill stats (% instead of constant).

Differences include: after killing enemy hero you can pick up 1 soul where they died (1 of 3 stat modifiers that can be farmed & spent/allocated in a match); edge-of-screen camera panning is silky smooth; no apparent OP ulti skills.

The skills seem like the least innovative & least attractive aspects of the game
column38: they're similar (pretty much identical) to skills from other mobas
column39: this might be to render the character more 'role-free' so you can be effective with them in any role but I dunno...\n\nFinal VerdictDeadbreed is quite satisfactory as a beta and a MOBARPG (heh)
column40: it delivers a lot of new things and I didn't see any freaky bugs yet. I do recommend this game
column41: whether my excitement is only temporary or long lasting. More than anything I think Deadbreed has a lot of potential
column42: especially if the dev team is willing to develop the game along with educated players' input. Even if the game doesn't grow in the end
column43: players should at least experience these innovations to the genre."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to like this game a lot, but I can't. Some of the design ideas are silly, like having to purchase new maps to play on. Most of the abilities either don't work half of the time, or just make no sense at all. This game tries way too hard to be way too unique.

The most fun I had with this game was the tutorial. The thing is so ♥♥♥♥ing buggy. You can legit press any button, and it'll highlight some imaginary area thinking that you've opened the tab you asked it to. I'm here looking at the store while it's telling me to pick a guardian for the map that's about to start".

Too many ideas to work with
date: none of them well executed.\n\nNot to mention the game crashes all the time out of nowhere. Also... time limits on maps are just... why? One of the developers must be some salty League of Legends player who didn't like getting absolutely creamed by the enemy team
recommended: and decided that the game should be focused on team points with a time limit. You can win this game without ever killing anyone.\n\nDevs bit off more than they can chew
hoursPlayed: that's all I can say. Interesting in theory

reviewText:
Early Access Review

·HUGE Potential!
·Long way far from finished. (The Devs say it will soon be at a 'Release State' but I believe otherwise - Maybe CBT at best)
·Unique features (such as: your character's appearance change with the equipment you buy, change your role according to the equipment you are wearing - even at the middle of a match, buy equipment with unique skills each, gameplay changes according to your Sentinel (Guardian - Final Boss) which you and your team votes for, GREAT visual effects and much more, It is not your typical MOBA) plus Dark freakin' atmosphere, which make this my best MOBA by far.
·BUT the game needs more Devs and a LOT more Players. (maybe merge the f***ing servers till we actually get a big player base going)

I play it off and on when there is an update...there is one every 5 months or so...... 10/10

reviewText: I personally dont like MOBAs but this sounded and looked intresting enough for me to try it briefly. the potential for this game is awesome though implementation, control and even the micro-transaction system for the game is horrible. Control is extremely limited very few options, no screen zooming, screen scrolling is difficult there is almost zero tutorials, you not instructed how to gain/upgrade or even use skills and abilities during play. Even the first solo starter mission is very confusing. All in all I cannot in my right mind recommend this game in its current state. It has tons of potential, nice graphics and some interesting starter lore but it needs so much more fleshed out for it to be made a interesting and even playable game.

voteText:
I'm going to go with a simple pros & cons.

Pro:
+Beautiful character and paperdoll assets
+Items are fully functional
+Dark environment with music that matches
+Dungeons are the new jungle
+Resource collection minigame is kinda neat with the different resource functions
+Character rental system is nice in a game that requires character purchase

Con:
-Game is severely difficult to jump in and play
-Lack of players means longer time waiting in queue
-Items and abilities are difficult to read
